Reviews.Content: My husband and myself went to Singapore to visit friends, the location is great. Fantastic for shopping! The rooms were a good size and always spotless!!! The breakfast was lovely, a huge choice of Western and Asian food and the staff were all very friendly and accomodating. We loved the pool and the views. I would and have recommended this Hotel to my family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise - great service”
Reviews.Author: Mairead29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in a stopover on our honeymoon. When they found out it was our honeymoon, even though we had booked it on points, they sent us a bottle of champagne which was a lovely touch. It is very centrally located in general but certainly for shopping along Orchard Road. Since we had a late night flight but had to check out earlier, we were invited to go to the fitness centre and have a shower, get ready for the flight prior to our departure, which was a great relief. Overall very good experience at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel - good value for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Manly-sider
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel on Orchard Road with good pubs, shops and restaurants right outside the door. Rooms are large and have been recently renovated with clean, contemporary design. The bed is one of the comfiest I've slept in. The work area is large although the glass-top desks are not very practical for the business traveller - has anyone else told hotels that laser mice don't work on see-through desks ;-). I have stayed a several other comparable hotels nearby and this is the best by far. The online rates are also better than most of the local competition. This has become my new preferred hotel in Singapore. Just one note of warning - this area has a large population of 'working girls' who hang out on the street outside. If you're here with a family, you might need to do some explaining why the locals are so friendly ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: happy_mommytraveler
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient. A leisurely stroll will take you to the best malls along Orchard. I stayed at the 19th floor and found the hallways clean and well-lit. I liked it that there is an additional security feature in the elevator. You have to insert your room card so you can press the number of your floor. The room is clean and comfortable. Bed and pillows are ok. Bathroom size is not bad. Well-maintained. It didn't really bother me much, but from the room, I can hear the cars along Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denwick
Reviews.Content: Situated on Orchard Road in Singapore's famous shopping precinct, the hotel has good rooms, service, facilities and is wihtin easy access to the MRT. The Orchard MRT train line is easy to get to via the Wheelock Place underpass which is just a block away from the hotel. The MRT is an easy, cheap, safe way to get around Singapore too. Room was very comfortable, well stocked with useful complimentary toiletries and tea/coffee making items. This hotel has probably been there a while but it's managing to to show it's age too badly. The in hotel health centre is good and therapy sessions worth utilising, i.e. massage, facials etc.

Reviews.Title: “Two visits, great lounge, dubious location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the top end of Orchard Road, close to several malls and the new ION complex. If you're going shopping on the road, this is an excellent location. It also has a number of nice places to eat close by, which is a bonus. Overall the front of the hotel looks dated and the lounge bar is not exactly top of it's class, it definately feels more like a tourist/shopping location more than business. The club lounge is well maintained, with good staff and a good range of refreshments, although not as good as the Conrad, which I would say has the business focus for the group in Singapore. The room I had on each visit was reasonable size, although the bathroom was small, the working area again small but mordern class table and working internet services maintained good links to my VPN for work. It's good without being spectacular. The only downside comes with the location as it is virtually across the road form Orchard Towers, Singapore's "pleasure" centre which means some characters on the road you may not like and it can generate a little hassle, although it's minimal I would not call that side of the road family friendly. If you can ignore it fine, but if it bothers you then this whole section of Orchard Road is probably not the place to stay. Not the hotel's fault, which itself does a very good job on security (passes needed for floor access via the lift) and service.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Hilton on and off for the past few months. It is a very busy hotel that likes to run on reputation vs service. Check in can be a hassle depending on the time of day. The Executive rooms are not that grand in any sense of the word. The bathrooms are tiny and the shower's are tub type. The Executive lounge is packed every night. Finding a place to sit is a real challenge. The food is not very "filling" or healthy. However the wine is free vs paying $14-20 US a glass in the lobby bar. The staff working the lounge are very nice and helpful. Location is on Orchard road, easy to walk anywhere. The gym is excellent (probably the best thing about this Hilton) and the roof top pool is nice. Overall I find this Hilton rather boring and outdated. In contrast the Conrad which is near downtown is a much better product and hotel. The funny thing is the Conrad has lower rates then this Hilton. If I was paying Conrad it would be and not this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the business traveler!!”
Reviews.Author: Rikbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Singapore Hilton from July 22 until July 30th. I stayed on the executive level and found the hotel staff to be polite, accomodating and just excellent to deal with. The facilities here are what you would expect, very nice. Great gym, wonderful rooftop pool, and and a very nice business lounge. The rooms are not as large as I would expect but that is normal for being outside of the USA. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Cleanliness was outstanding. Service was outstanding. The morning breakfast buffet was extensive and delicous. Location near the Ion department store on Orchard road is great and provides easy access to the MRT subway line which is the way to get around in Singapore. I would especially like to recongnize Natalia from the front desk and other areas who was a gem in being helpful with a variety of questions and issues.

Reviews.Title: “Past its best”
Reviews.Author: Tobeconfirmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for two nights and what my friends and colleagues told me when I said I was staying there rang true: a rather tired hotel and not the best location. It is not close to the main business district and the hotel itself is very dated. The gentleman in charge of seating guests for breakfast was officious and bordering on the rude. Other than these issues, the hotel is adequate. I have certainly stayed in nicer properties in SIngapore: I chose to stay here on the basis of the rates our firm received here, and on that measure, it was cheaper than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet our expectations”
Reviews.Author: ABSViews
Reviews.Content: We were influenced by friends who have been staying at the Hilton every time they have visited Singapore for the past 20 years. Our experience was mixed but will not go back again. Fpr a five star hotel, a few things were not up to standard. The location is great - right on Orchard Road and a short walk to all the shopping and MRT station. Our first impression was on check-in when we were told that they could not fulfill our booking for a non-smoking king size room. We protested and they quickly found a room for us - why wasn't this offered up front? As soon as we stepped into the room, we noticed that the carpet was very stained and this was off putting - couldn't it have been steam cleaned? The bathroom was tiny and had a curtain over a shower/bath. Our bath mat was removed after the first night and we ended up using hand towels for the floor. Water leaked from the shower down one side of the wall and partly flooded the bathroom floor - we couldn't figure out how. Had we misplaced the curtain whilst using the shower? The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. The bar downstairs is quite nice and a couple sing jazz there most nights which adds a nice touch. The buffet breakfast food I ate was very ordinary. There was no sign of any tropical fruit - where were the mangoes, papayas, star fruits and other delicious south east Asian fruits? The yogurt tasted a little passe. I then went to the hot food section and picked a nice lotus pau. I also had the potato omelette which was very dry, the baked tomatoes and a sausage which were ok. The water from the water dispenser was contaminated by fridge smells and tasted awful. On our last night, we had a terrible time there. We came back from dinner and decided to have a drink at the rooftop bar. We arrived and were greeted by the Manager (?) with a warm smile. We asked if we could have a drink and she pointed us to the outside pool area where the bar was. We arrived and while trying to find a suitable seat, the waiter approached us and told us that the bar and pool area were closed for a private function. Pardon? We were just welcomed at the door. Should we leave we asked? No, we could have a drink but we would need to be quick quick. So that really annoyed us but determined to savour our final night before an early morning departure, we persevered. I ordered a sherry and my husband ordered a whisky. My sherry didn't taste like a sherry, so I told my husband it didn't taste right and we quizzed the barman. He had poured me a cheap port, not a sherry. My palate is good and I sent him off to get what I had ordered. Anyway, we only stayed for a "quick" drink and went back to our room. Within about one hour, we were awakened by roadworks right underneath our window, even though we were on the 15th floor, it was unbearably loud. This went on until 3am... We just could not sleep and the night manager kindly accommodated our request to move us to a quieter room which wasn't that much better because it still faced the roadworks. Not at all their fault, but can you believe it? Anyway, for the inconvenience, we were transferred to the airport the next morning free of charge by the hotel. A nice gesture for something which really wasn't their fault. Would we go back? No. Would we recommend it to anyone? No. There are too many other better hotels in Singapore we have stayed in before and enjoyed better, not sure why we bothered to try something a bit different this time.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Singapore 07/2011”
Reviews.Author: blueskies15-10
Reviews.Content: hotel is located in the shopping area Orchard Road, close to the MRT subway station and ION shopping centre, rooms are spaceous and comfortable, daily free newspaper as hhonors member, really pricy with 391 S$ incl. breakfast plus taxes, value was better last time, internet (slow at night) was hefty wit h83 S$ for 3 days, other Hilton do not charge, breakfast ara was very noisy and uncomfortable (dishes, glasses were staples by waiters etc), fitness center is nice on 23rd floor, business center personnel very friendly, overall the service is not up to the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Busienss”
Reviews.Author: AJCSPC
Reviews.Content: On the heart of the city extremely functional and overall perfect in all the scenes. Great Value and the Food is excellent price quality. The Sunday Brunch of the chart!!! Love Hilton Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. An average/ok four star hotel in an average location”
Reviews.Author: mjc1959
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal hilton member for a decade. This hotel is ok but absolutely nothing special. Their website didn't work and so I just showed up and booked a room at the front desk, and the cost was staggering. I usually get a room upgrade for being a diamond vip but not this time. So I paid literally double new york prices for what felt like an airport hotel. The room was ok, the bed was good, the bathroom was small but everything worked. The immediate question for any hotel is "would you stay again?" and in this case, the answer is a resounding 'no.' There are s many choices of hotels in singapore and this one just isn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with no smile, not Hilton standard !”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: We checked in on July 15 and stayed there for two nights after my business meeting at Sands Resort. My wife is a Silver HH members. We booked the room thru a travel agency in HK. On arrival, the staff at the check in counter was 'cold with no smile at all'. The hotel overall shows signs of age. On July 16 we went down for breakfast at 9:45am and was surprised to find that the cafe was full. We needed to wait about 10 minutes in order to get our table (we did not make reservation but we did not make reservation for breakfast in any other Hiltons either). The food was average. Too many tables. Too many guests. The service staff made lots of noises talking and preparing tables. Check out was fast. Hotel location is perfect but so are many other hotels around. Certainly not worth the money I paid. Should have stayed at the Sands for the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good experience staying at the Hilton at Orchard road. It centrally located on Orchard with walking distance to the major shopping spots. Rooms are ok and quite average. Service is the standard excellent service I usually get form 4 and 5 stars hotels in Asia. Food and drinks are very expensive compared to what you can get other places in Singapore, but around western standards. I enjoyed the pool and pool bar at the top floor. There is also a large gym in the hotel. Being fairly expensive the hotel delivers on my expectations, but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: perthguy6
Reviews.Content: Small rooms expensive,average service, club loung is sub par compared to Shangrila, pan pacific and intercontinental and not enough seating, breakfast is a disappointment, housekeeping poor pool quite small, location is great and the concierge is very helpful. Would we stay again.... No!

Reviews.Title: “Unripe on Orchard”
Reviews.Author: UponArrival
Reviews.Content: Hard to find, but after much research I found a hotel that offered rooms with private balconies overlooking the city. That hotel was the Hilton Singapore. Shame is, that upon check-in I learned they had given away my balcony room and put me in a standard business room. I was paying for a King Hilton Executive Plus, so I made sure that they adjusted the rate to the less-than room. If I hadn't mentioned it, it wouldn't have happened. So, after all the research, no fruit from the Hilton on Orchard Road. Instead, overpriced so-so hotel that came with big regrets. Room service was odd -- they answer as though room service was something they'd never thought of, an entirely new concept to the Hilton chain. Err, umm, sure, we can deliver? Yea, good thing, 'cause I'm what you might call starved. An hour later a sad burger arrived. I was sad too. It was to get better. After 20+ hours of flying I fall asleep before my body hits the bed. I'm off in a never-world of sleep, sleep so deep you could drift off forever into it. 3 hours into this sleep I'm blasted into hyper-reality with a screeching alarm and voices yelling something at me over an intercom. I jump out of my bed, I stumble around in circles not knowing where I am, who I am, if I'm dead, if this is real. I rush to the door, I can't figure out what's screeching so loudly, in my stupor I think that if I can squeeze the doorknob on the entry door it will all stop. As I'm squeezing, I start to gain some of my senses and I begin to hear what is being said over the intercom. The woman's voice is informing me that there has been a fire alarm activated and to stay calm and wait in my room while they assess the situation. Doesn't take me but a few seconds to assess my situation, I'm on one of the highest floors in the hotel, it may be on fire and I'm being told to stay put and stay tuned. Guess what Hilton Singapore? I lived through 911 and I know what to do when you're in a highrise and there may be a fire and someone is telling me to stay put. Guess what I do then Hilton? I get out as fast as my two legs will take me. On go the jeans, t-shirt and shoes and I'm rushing down the fire escape two steps at a time. 21st floor, 20th floor, 19th floor and so on. It seems as though I'll never get out, but I do. I go out to the street in front of the hotel and every light is on in every single room. Lemmings, this is exactly why people don't survive in hotel fires. False alarm or not, I'm finding out which it is from the safety of the street. You only live through 911 once. Hour later it's confirmed it was a small kitchen fire that was put out. Thanks Hilton. Can't fall back asleep. Hilton has assured that I'll be going on 3 hours sleep. That's enough, I could go on to describe the other let downs the hotel had in store for me, but I hate to be pegged as a complainer. Forget this place and just book a shophouse suite at the Intercontinental -- wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: LucWise
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very expensive, but you always pay high rates in Singapore. The property is well located in the Orchard Road district, which is great for shopping, people watching and eating. I was disappointed with the size of the room. I found it to be really tiny, although I will admit they did try to make it as nice as possible with some updated furniture. The pool on the roof seemed nice but it rained the two nights I was there so I didn't get a chance to use it. Overall, this property is OK. I'm not sure I would stay here again for the rate I paid. Finally, check it was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Yashoo99
Reviews.Content: Overall a good stay. Breakfast is good but the food at Checkers for dining definitely needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Time to renovate?”
Reviews.Author: syloft
Reviews.Content: Managed to grab a night's stay from Priceline.com at a pretty good rate just for the long weekend. Location wise, it's centrally located in the main shopping area in Orchard, with easy access to the malls and restaurants. However, we were quite disappointed with the room's condition. Signs of wear and tear were showing in the room and toilet. Given that this is a Hilton hotel, we were expecting something nicer. Another saving grace is that Crabtree and Evelyn's La Source toiletries were provided which we find it much better than some of the other big hotel chains. Side-track to food, one of the must try is the hotel's macarons! One of the best so far in Singapore! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: dd1153
Reviews.Content: Really average, was not what i was expecting. The staff are friendly and rooms clean and restful. Position is not great and I feel the price is not justified when compared to others. but otherwise a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: I got two connecting standard rooms for the Easter break. Decent interior since the hotel renovated, although the exterior is still the old design. Service is good to average although needs to be refined a bit. Aslo since the renovation this hotel charges more, even more than sister hotel Conrad. Likely also due to the prime location. The rooms are on the smallish side and am not quite sure if the cabinets and bathrooms were renovated or not. It is right on Orchard and a short walk to the intersection of Orchard and Scotts road where all the shopping is. Starbucks is a 5 min walk in either direction of the hotel and so is the Coffee Bean. I found the room service to be good, as the food was warm and the service is fast. Free bottles of water replenished every day. Airconditioning is cold, required for a hot city like Singapore, and the beds are comfortable. If you can get a good price (I booked and prepaid on hilton's website) it is a good value. Tips on going to Universal Studios - it is small and can be completed in half a day. Go around 3 or 4 in the afternoon (they close at 9pm) when the sun isn't too hot. Try a weekday or a Sunday afternoon for less crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GoneFishing
Reviews.Content: Great service and hotel was well kept. Have been to thid hotel many times when I travel to Singapore. From the time you pull up to the hotel to the time you check out, this is one of the best locations I have stayed while traveling in SE Asia. The Bell staff greats you and welcomes you back if you are a returning guest, and several of them remember your name. I will continue to stay there each time I travel to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Really worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: jpwilli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with spouse and adult child. Rooms was exceptionally comfortable - all beds were good. Plenty of space. Design is modern and stylish. Our room was streetside which meant a great view and no noise. Bathroom was roomy with Crabtree and Evelyn products as a real treat. Location near the new Icon shopping means it is good to walk anywhere on Orchard road so wear flat shoes! Lots of nearby fast food or great restaurants. If you can get a good deal definately choose this one!

Reviews.Title: “Not to the mark of Hilton quality”
Reviews.Author: Stantsia
Reviews.Content: Location is good.I was however not impresed by the asthetics of rooms,the lobby area.I would not complain about service .Staff is freindly,room service takes time.Varity of inhouse resturents is limited.In total not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid choice”
Reviews.Author: johngie
Reviews.Content: I found the Hilton to be a very solid choice for Singapore - I had an exec room on the club floor which was well worth the extra. Nice size room, decent furnishings and a nice private balcony. The club lounge was never over-crowded and I had breakfast there every morning for 6 days and it was always pretty peaceful (now I was eating between 6.30 and 7.30am so can't speak to later in the morning). Breakfast there was good and varied. Pool deck on the roof was very nice and the fitness center is decently fitted out. Service was usual Singapore excellent and although there are more luxurious hotels in Singapore, this one is very centrally located for getting to business meetings and you can step out of the lobby and walk the length of Orchard Road's best shopping. Good for business and probably good for leisure if you want to be in the center.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanuja27
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel very much, would stay here during all my visits. it is very well located and close to the shopping area. good eating place around the hotel.the rooms are comfortable and the breakfast is a wide spread. would recomend to all,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul034
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed staying in Hilton Singapore. Prime location on orchard road. Room was spacious and well cleaned. We had breakfast at club floor and main restaurant and we loved both. Will definitely return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel prime location good food”
Reviews.Author: Experiences88
Reviews.Content: Enjoy staying here with my family. Prime location on orchard road. We have 3 rooms. Very nice staff to accommodate on the same floor even they wer full. Concierge very nice in providing information. Rooms are spacious. Buffer breakfast with varieties of food and choices. Friendly restaurant staff who can speak thai. Will definitely return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,pay little extra and stay at club rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MANISH999
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and my 6 yr old son throughly enjoyed our stay at the club rooms which are worth that extra 50 US dollars .in the evenings I and my son made full use of the club hours enjoying drinks and ben n Jerry ice creams and sushi and chocolates ! It has a lovely view of the city . The conceierge is more than helpfull and they always note the cab nos and are kind enough to carry our shipping bags . Try and eat at MODESTOs which is to the right of the hotel it serves the best Italian food in Singapore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: carnage99
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why the previous reviewer thinks the lobby and rooms need renovating, as the lobby is absolutely fine and I've stayed twice in the past two years (including a couple of weeks ago) and the rooms are fresh, up-to-date and spacious. The location is great - near lots of shopping and cafes. They also offered me late checkout (4pm). The only gripe is that it was a bit expensive. I would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vijayant2011
Reviews.Content: The stay at The Hilton was for 5 nights & was for the purpose of a short vacation along with my wife & 8 year old son. From the outset, I found the Hotel staff extremely professional & accomodating - they helped us with an early check-in as our flight into S'pore reaches many hours before the usual check-in hour. They also provided a late check out on the last day which tied-in nicely with our return flight plan. A tip: helps to be Hilton Honors (HHonors) members. The Hotel is located on Orchard Rd. with a number of other 5/7 star hotels like the Hyatt, Marriot in the vicinity besides a large number of shopping malls. It is also very conveniently located near the Orchard MRT (just about 100 mts) & making 'self travel' around town very easy. The attached ION Mall on the MRT is a great place to shop & dine. The Hotel itself, gives the impression of a well heeled place. The refurbished deluxe rooms were well appointed & spacious. The place has a decent size pool & restaurant on the roof. All in all an excellent option to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too expensive - and still paid internet !”
Reviews.Author: sundboell
Reviews.Content: Pros - great location - walking distance to all Orchard Road - lives up to the Hilton name in terms of service, cleanliness etc Cons; - paying - exorbitantly - for internet access - too expensive, comparably - rooms neither this, nor that. Dull decoration, too cheap, no real view I still cannot believe in this day and age that a worldwide chain like Hilton, at the prices they charge, cannot offer a simple internet access for free. It could be limited to say 100mb per day - but don't charge me sgd 25 /day for something that today is close to a birth right for the traveller. It gives me a bad taste that Hilton - and other hotels - are making a revenue stream (and profit !) from this, akin to start charging for the soap !

Reviews.Title: “A truly brilliant business experience”
Reviews.Author: divyageorge83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I after while on business in Singapore decided to stay at the HILTON. Its a perfect place to stay while on business and otherwise. Located right in the center of town, it allows you to get around with ease. The hotel is well kept with friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. Rooms have exceptional bathrooms that are clean with all amenities. The rooms also have wired net connection. The hotel also offers 2 restaurants which serve a variety of food. The buffet breakfast was sumptuous and offered a fine selection of food. Service is prompt and doesn't take time. They also have While checking out our flight was delayed and we had to check out later than expected. The hotel allowed us a late check out without a problem and dint charge us either for couple of extra hours of stay. The Hilton in Singapore is the only place I stay in Singapore while on business.

Reviews.Title: “Old is GOLD”
Reviews.Author: RohitL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few times at the Hilton, usually for 1-2 nights on each occasion and have found the same level of service each time. I've only used the hotel as a bread & breakfast. Although located in the middle of Orchard (shopping paradise) it is a no-nonsense business hotel. Perfect for the business traveller. Since it's a little cramped (the coffee shop / breakfast area) etc... I wouldn't suggest for couples traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Versailles2011
Reviews.Content: Okay...just stayed at this hotel for a few nights. Arrived from the States fast check-in process cannot fault it. The concierge Piexuan and Arrifin were both wonderful always gracious on emails, helpful, warm and friendly in person with a kind smile. Day 1: The breakfast staff placed my group at a center table and were very attentive. Days 2 and 3: We were placed at a table against the wall and I do believe we became invisible because we had to search for people to top up our coffee as at no time was more coffee offered and the tea was luke warm at best. I had some trouble with my hot iron for my hair so I requested assistance with the adaptor, the hotel "Engineer" came to my assistance and proceeded to plug my very expensive hot iron into the wrong outlet and to my horror and scream I watched as it sparked and smoke emitted from the iron killing it instantly. Head engineer came to my room and advised the "engineer" that he used the wrong plug. I didn't want the poor man to get into trouble as I do believe that lack of training was the problem there, so I asked the hotel manger that no fuss be made, I did get a box of 8 chocolates as compensation for my $150.00 hot iron...not complimentary drinks or dinner but 8 okay quality chocolates. Wonderful concierge and doormen, very good breakfast, great location. Would I stay there again...NO....because I said that no fuss should be made does not mean that the manager shouldn't have offered some type of compensation as a gesture of goodwill. Hilton Honors member also.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Quality superb”
Reviews.Author: sylisletravellertips
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore, and was taken to hotel on a luxury coach. Arrived and checked in without any difficulty. Luggage already in suite when I opened my door. The suites were immaculate. I always ate my meals in the hotel, when on menu plan. The amenities were close by, on Orchid Street, I visited a hair salon and highly recommend them. The color and cut and wash and head massage were above par of anything else I had experienced in my travels around the world. I felt very safe walking around Singapore on my own, when I did not feel like going with the group. This is an amazing, clean and friendly city to visit, and I would revisit it time and again without second thought. On my recommendation, reserve your seat on the most friendly, clean airline, Singapore Airlines and visit this wonderful, small country and aquaint yourself with their peoples.

Reviews.Title: “very corteous and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Dungdang
Reviews.Content: Had an onenighter to Singapore for my threemonthly medceck. Checked in at Hilton Orchard at 10.30 PM and was onin my room in a jiffy. Request for late checkout 3PM was accepted without any question. The bellboy, an elderly gentleman who looked and moved exactly like Freddy Finton fromth the famous sketch "dinner for one" added a newspaper to my luggage, took me to my room and explained everything I needed to know. The breakfast buffet was excellent and checking out was concluded in a minute. All the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful all the time.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of Orchard road”
Reviews.Author: globetravelerNL
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel 4 + 2 nights in March 2011. It is in the middle of Orchard road with all things like shops and bar's on close walking distance. I normally stay in Conrad but choose this time Hilton for reason of existing on our company rate preferred hotels. Standard rooms were not available any more, one week-upfront-booking, so was offered the bussiness suite upgrade with lounge-access for 100 Sin$. The room was "average 5*" with good sleeping quality bed-softness. wide assorted amnities on bathroom. The free lounge drink and buffet certainly can be used as "dinner-replacement". The serving personell very helpfull. All in all a pleasant stay, which decided me to book the additional 2 day's on return to singapore after first 4 day's stay. Would stay here certainly again next time for overall impression and location. However still prefer the "KING SIZE bedsize" at Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice refurbished rooms, good staff "Hilton" service”
Reviews.Author: marnie_g2001
Reviews.Content: We were well looked after at the Hilton on the 11th floor with a view over Orchard Rd. Large modern rooms, good attentative staff, and knowledgable concierge. Wonderful buffet breakfasts. Do have a cocktail in the evenings at the rooftop pool bar and enjoy the "lights" The lobby area is a little dated and the roof spa is cold because it is attached to the main pool. Great location for shopping. Try the Food Republic Food Court 4th fIoor Ion Bulding for inexpensive fresh food & juices for lunch & Bread Society a stand up or take away pastry bread shop on basement 2 where Wheelock Place meets ION 2 - Gives Paris a nudge for its delicious pastries! Yummo!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could improve”
Reviews.Author: MustaPekka
Reviews.Content: Checkin was rather slow and very little information was given to me by receptionist. Room was very nice and spacious. Interior was up to date and in very good condtion. WIFI did not work as I could not log in. Had to go to the reception, and they struggled themselves for a while before it got working. WIFI was then cut off after 24 hours, and had to once more go down to reception in order to log in. This was clearly a disappointment ! Otherwise WIFI was fairly fast and stable. Breakfast was very good having all kind of selections including chinese, japanese, indian and western. Enjoyed it ! Gym was very nice as well as swimming pool area. Hotel is very centrally located with walking distance to shopping, restaurants, pubs etc. Had requested a quite room, but still I could hear traffic from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Snakeboy10
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were extremelly helpful and always on hand to advise. We had arrived into Singapore early in the morning and upon arriving our room was not available but access was provided for us to shower and then use the club lounge for breakfast. We had paid for a club/executive room and with this the lounge access provided was superb. We had breakfast served there daily and there was afternoon tea and cakes followed in the evening by canapes and a choice of alcholic beverages as well as hot and soft drinks throughout the day. The hotel is positioned towards the top end of Orchard Road but in a great location for the shops and the local mass transit station. There are always taxis available outside the entrance too whcih the concierge will hail and liaise with the driver for you. The only disappointment was the cleanliness of the roof top pool which had a lot of dirt in it. The following day this had all gone though. If your looking to explore Singapore, this hotel is well positioned and I would recommend paying the extra for a club/executive room.

Reviews.Title: “Agree, location best feature - if you're a tourist that wants to shop”
Reviews.Author: NoneNixNada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for the first time during a business trip in January, and thought that it was certainly a good hotel, but it was a bit tired and in need of some updating. It is also not the most convenient location for the business traveler. While it's location is not horrible for the business traveler (Singapore is not a big place, after all), I have usually stayed at hotels closer to downtown (e.g., Conrad, Ritz Carlton, Fullerton, etc.). With that said, however, if you are a tourist and want to be close to the Orchard/Scotts Road area for shopping, the location is ideal. I also found the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms comfortable. So, overall I found this an average + hotel with the location being the best feature if you are a tourist looking to shop.

Reviews.Title: “You're Damned if You Do and Damned if You Don't”
Reviews.Author: HedonistLondon
Reviews.Content: Dear oh dear... For this stay I had booked an up-grade (if available) to a suite and it was made available at check-in. However, it turned out to be a bad hand of cards. The room in general was refurbished, but the minibar section, wash basin / kitchenette combination (very odd) and whole bathroom were more Golden girls than modern hotel. Even worse, the room door did not live up to the expectations one would have for a Hilton suite as it did not close fully and felt very shaky. Even if it was Singapore, you'd expect to feel complete secure in your room. This issue was brought to the attention of the hotel (Executive lounge staff). First time nothing was done to make it right. Only after talking to the duty manager things were checked. After lenghty wait and trial to change the actual door it was evident that nothing could be done - this was a structural issue. Two other suites were available, but unfortunately they had the same problem, and for one of them the same issue was even more severe. So the hotel was not able to get it right. Some chocolates were sent to the room next day, but apart from being a nice gesture that did not change the fact that have more severe issues. We were booked in a different hotel for two following nights and had a one night stay booked here after that. However, we did not return as the first experince this time was not anywhere near the level of expectations. Singapore has a lot of good quality hotels and it appears that the Hilton needs to catch up. I have stayed here before and it is sad to notice the decline.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: chadnelsonminnesota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hilton Singapore for 5 nights during our honeymoon. The service of the staff was top notch. The rooms were slightly dated but the bedding and bathrooms were especially nice. We stayed here for 3 nights then spent a week in Thailand and came back for 2 more! While we were away the held some bags for us free of charge! The best part of this hotel is the location! Right downtown and right next to an MRT station! If you prefer a taxi those were readily available in front of the hotel also or a quick call to the front desk and they would have one waiting for you! The service and management of this hotel is top of the line. If you can afford a meal at the new Il Cielo Restaurant on the top floor I would highly recommend it! We had an absolutely incredible meal there on the last night of our trip! A true class restaurant and hotel! We also loved the free wi-fi, drinks and apps in the Executive Lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Blown away by the little things”
Reviews.Author: jiber
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in a hilton hotel but I was very impressed. The room was great, spacious and had nice decor. Also the welcome fruit/chocolate/flowers were a very nice touch. But the thing I was most blown away by were the cleaners. They did an amazing job every day. Even folding my dirty underwear. Had a good gym with lots of weights so I was still able to do a solid workout. Overall I would say the worst is the pool. Pretty small and boring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service”
Reviews.Author: ChiGuy65
Reviews.Content: We were at this centrally located hotel for 2 stays of a week each. The staff at the front desk and executive lounge remembered us on our return trip. Good location from which to explore Singapore. Within walking distance to the Botanical Gardens and just steps from Orchard MRT station. The breakfast buffet was wonderful with very good local fare.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Location, location, location.. and if you got it at a discount, it's an overall good value too!”
Reviews.Author: GOPBI
Reviews.Content: This is an update to my prior review of 04 January 2010. I stayed here for one night on 11February 2011, as this is our designated crew hotel for all layover crew stays while in Singapore. This hotel also hosts crews from several other airlines from across the world. By far, this hotels single best feature is its LOCATION. It is located right on Singapore’s most famous street-- Orchard Road. If you’re into shopping, this is THE place to be- bar none! The hotel is located on the northwest end of Orchard Road, and from here you can easily walk the length of the road stopping at any of the major mall complexes or access the public transportation systems (bus or subway-MRT). It’s located almost directly across the street from the Royal Thai Embassy and within a few minutes walk from several key shopping locations such as Tang’s Plaza. Shaw House, and Wisma Atria- to name just a few. The closest MRT station is Orchard station (NS22) and is less than a five-minute walk from the hotel front door. The hotel building itself is one of the older physical properties on Orchard and in the immediate area, but has undergone renovations to modernize. Most all of the guest rooms have been fully remodeled and as well as most of the dining and beverage venues. The hotel does show some architectural signs of its true “age”-- the rooms actual square size-- but overall it’s been well maintained and modernized. ==> Lobby / Check-in: As is customary with airline crew, our rooms are pre-assigned and pre-paid, so there no real check-in formalities; they only need to distribute individual room keys. Guests who are members of the Hilton HHonors program have a dedicated use check-in desk. The hotel is shaped as an open centered rectangle with guest rooms along the perimeter of each floor. There are twin floor-to-ceiling glass elevators on each end of the hotel. The open lobby bar area has an impressive view of the hotel and the upper floors. ==> Room: My room was an “Executive” level room on the 12th floor. It was done in cooling shades of white, off-white and light wood colors. The bed was a standard King size and was of a moderate firmness. Lots of pillows and there was a light duvet. The room also had a medium size glass-top work desk with multi-phone, multi-power ports and wired internet access. Wireless internet access is available (for an extra charge or included with higher room rates) the TV was a flat screen LCD TV with full local and international programming. Among the nice touches was the provisioned in-room coffee and tea set and stocked mini-bar (but at typically high mini-bar rates). The tinted glass windows are large with great city views and well sound. The drapes are not “black-out” so those who are sensitive to light may find sleeping difficult after sunrise hours. ==> Bathroom: This is where the hotels original dated construction shows—the bathroom footprint was a bit on a smaller side.. but.. it as well equipped with a tub/shower combination. The hot water ran immediately hot and the pressure was excellent. There was a nice selection of Hilton-label pre and post-bath toiletries. There was a magnification (make-up) mirror as well as a mini hair dryer. No bath robes provided. ==> Hotel facilities and Amenities: The hotel has three dining venues- a seafood/grill, casual brasserie and a deli. In addition there is a “juice bar” and the lobby lounge. I did have breakfast at the grill and it was good, but priced at a premium. I will say that the hotel appears to have a decent range of dining options all in-house. Remember that Singapore is a foodies heaven and there are many, many excellent and value-priced dining and drinking options near the hotel and within an easy commute. So, you are by no means ‘hostage’ to the hotel options. This is NOT to say they’re not good—my breakfast was rather good, only that you have lots of options should you choose to avail of such. ==> Leisure amenities include a large roof top pool with sun chairs and tables with sun umbrellas- and have some good views of the surrounding Orchard street area. It is possible to order food and drink from here as well. The hotel has a smaller gym with basic exercise equipment and a modest selection of free weights. The business center can handle most all your needs: copy/print/fax, computer use, basic secretarial and translation services are available. You can send/receive your FedEx, UPS and DHL packages here as well. It’s open 24/7, but after-hours you need to contact the Front Desk for assistance and access. Like most four and five star hotels they can accommodate your medical services, daycare/childcare and travel agent services needs. SUMMARY: PROS: This hotel’s single biggest plus is its location, location and location. Quite simply, this place is hard to beat since it’s right at the beginning of Orchard Street—the highest profile shopping district in all of Singapore. Naturally owning to the location you also have very quick and convenient access to local public transport (bus, subway, taxi) from here as well. The staff was attentive, prompt and efficient and will to help you as requested or needed. The hotel does have very good and comprehensive in-house dining options, but again, due to the excellent location, you’re well within easy commute distance to other options in the surrounds areas. If you can find a discounted room rate, it can be an exceptional overall value when you consider the hotel, location and facilities. CONS: The hotel is one of the older structural properties and as such, some of the rooms and bathrooms show their age by virtue of their smaller size—as compared to newer built hotels. However, it’s undergone a complete “face-lift” and most all of the guest areas are as good as other newer built properties. This hotel doesn’t have as many of the newest “bells & whistles” as some of the newer and larger properties in the area. RATINGS: I give them a 5/5 for Cleanliness, Service, Location and Value. I never saw anything dirty or in disrepair; the service was typically Asian- prompt and professional; the location is it's single best selling point; if you get a room here at a discount, it's a great value. I gave them a 3/5 for rooms *only* due to the fact that the rooms are a bit on the smaller side than what today's average room looks like-- but this is more a factor of the hotels original construction date and not a deliberate shortcoming of the hotel itself. Lastly, I assigned them a 4/5 for sleep quality only because the lack of black-out drapes makes sleeping after sunrise a challenge. If this matters to you, then I'd give it a 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stopover perfection for two nights at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: pvk4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well run I couldnt fault it. I paid through a singapore airlines stopover which included free transfers both ways to airport. and was a very reasonable price for the 5star standard that this Hilton offers. I have been used to flying direct from Australia to UK but now this experience has spoiled me forever. The tour i booked at the hotel desk for $32 was also excellent value and took in all the important sites in one afternoon. Highly recommended for any traveller who wants a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KTC_2011
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was courteous and very helpful. It is located in the center of the city with close proximity to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Central location at the Orchard road”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang_Frankfurt
Reviews.Content: Located at the upper Orchard road which is the center for shopping and major attractions in Singapore. From the Hilton you reach the high frequently visited locations very quick thanks to the MTR station (3 min walking distance) or taxis. The rooms are renovated and ok, though the size of the standard room could be bigger. The breakfast buffet offers the full variety of Japanese, Asian, Indian and Western style breakfast. The price-performance ratio is good and with hotel you definitely won't make a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton or Conrad Singapore? Solid Hilton hotel, but would stay at Conrad instead.”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Conrad Singapore a couple times, I decided to try the Hilton Sinagpore, which is located conveniently on Orchard Road. This is certainly a solid Hilton hotel with regard to the overall hardware and software, but I'll be at the same time comparing to this stay to my experiences at Conrad Singapore as well. I stayed a standard deluxe room (with executive lounge access) for the first night and paid an upgrade to the King suite (executive suite) for the second night. The standard room is just--standard. Nothing special to write home about, with all the standard flat screen TV, good wireless itnernet, and a very comfy bed. Staff was generally helpful as I arrrived past midnight and checkin process was smooth. Conrad, on the other hand, had bigger rooms, more TV channels for selection, a bathroom which is superior to that of Hilton (better amentities and decoration). The bed at Conrad is even better (albeit the beds being very "high") The King suite that I stayed in the second night was a pleasant surprise-- a lot better than I had anticipated. A very spacious living room and a slightly better bedroom. There is a separate shower and a bathtub which is a welcoming change. Should you stay at the Hilton the suite is a good choice for bigger groups (I was travelling solo). Conrad suites, on the other hand, are nice but the use of space was not very clever as there were a lot of "empty" spaces that could be utilised better--but besides this Conrad suites win hands down. I have read about the executive loung at the Hilton being very full nearing 6pm--and this is certainly true. I was at the lounge at around half 5 in the evening and it was rather empty, but as 6 approaches suddenly dozens of people appear in the lounge and seats and sofas get occupied very quickly--definitely need to go up earlier should you wish to secure seats with a table as well. Lounge staffs were very nice and helpful. Food selection was, however, slightly limited. The Conrad lounge is certainly a lot better once again, as the food selection is a lot better than the lounge at Hilton, and the alcoholic drink selection is better at the Cornad as well. So what does this mean? I guess the bottom line is that if you wish to spend more time using the hotel facilities and the room itself, definitely go for Conrad. The location of the Hilton is really the only reason why I chose it this time round--but Singapore is a small place so Conrad isn't too far off though. This Hilton is a solid hotel, but just that the Conrad , at least to me, is miles better and sometimes you can get a cheaper rate at the Conrad than Hilton. All in all a solid Hilton hotel but would suggest Conrad for a better overall experience in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “much improved service”
Reviews.Author: swiss_global_trip
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago, I stopped staying at Singapore Hilton because of bad service attitude - a rare thing in Asia and therefore plenty of other option. By coincindence, I was booked into the Singapore Hilton again and pleasantly surprised. Rooms, restaurants, lobby are still the same, apart from minor maintenance. However, staff attitude has changed a lot to the positive. Staff is friendly, helpful and efficient. Congratulations for this turn around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: AspiringFoodie
Reviews.Content: Booked two connecting rooms through priceline and got upgraded on check-in. Staff was very accommodating, rooms and sheets were constantly cleaned (have two toddlers who are very messy). Complimentary mineral water replenished twiced a day, fresh fruits, newspaper, crabtree bathroom toiletries were much appreciated. Each room had their own DVD players connected to the LCD tv. Room service was responsive when we ordered a midnight snack for our hungry baby girl. Overall, service was excellent. From the doorman, bellboy, reception, concierge, house cleaning and room service. Our kids had a great time. Location was close to everything. Mcdonalds, Wendys, Starbucks, 7 Eleven, ATM and MTR within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in the business category; better suited for leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: Robert94110
Reviews.Content: Pros: excellent breakfast, dining options, very nice swimming pool on top of the hotel Cons: feels a bit outdated; rooms are small and below par for today's standards; no free internet!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: motmots
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Singapore during a stopover flight to Australia. The hotel is very clean, the staff very helpful and friendly. The rooms are a good size, clean and comfortable. The hotel amenities are great, especially the swimming pool and gym. Breakfast choice was good too, with a wide choice for all palates. It is located on Orchard Avenue, one of the main shopping streets in central Singapore. To walk from the hotel to the marina via Fort Canning Park took us a good 40 mins, but was very pleasant as there is so much to see. The river walk is the best route to follow. Definately recommed this hotel if you wish to explore Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location , small room”
Reviews.Author: ExploreinLuxury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Orchard Road which is the main road in Singapore. Service was good at main desk. Rooms were on time,. Carpeted floor, very cozy room but a bit small. Not such a great view. Not much cupboard space Shower in the bathtub Bathroom is small TV Channels were limited Comfortable stay but could be better room size

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: established hotel in great location on orchard rd. arrived late at night and left early next morning. not happy when front desk forgot my wake up call and just made flight. this shouldn't happen at 5 star property. rooms have been refubished since my last visit, although they now need to update bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mdap010111
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hilton Hotel Singapore. The Hotel is in an excellent location and good value for money. The Hotel staff were efficient and helpful. They were very helpful in recommending and booking tours.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: Hilton Singapore is super conveniently situated on bustling Orchard Rd – Singapore’s thoroughfare wildly renowned as a shopper’s paradise. In fact even within Hilton’s own walls, luxury shops await your patronage (that is of course if you must indulge in some retail therapy right away and the behemoth complexes that line Orchard can’t wait). Besides its ideal location and friendly hospitality, Hilton Singapore comes with addnl. Hilton perks, especially for HHonors members: dedicated check-ins, free (depending on availability) room upgrades, complimentary hi speed internet connection and, in some cases, complimentary breakfast buffet – which can be enjoyed in the Executive Lounge or in the main dining hall on the lobby level. Though I should note that –even as an HHonors member— I much rather enjoyed having breakfast in the main dining hall as opposed to the Executive Lounge; the variety of food items – continental and Pan Asian alike were more varied and the atmosphere a little less formal. The Executive Lounge—to give it its props though—is great for a little more quiet and seclusion should you need a little bit of serenity in the mornings. Rooms are pretty spacious with plush bedding, decent size work stations, flat screen TVs and, bathrooms, like other Hilton Hotels, feature toiletries by Crabtree and Evelyn. A word of caution that rooms that face the street tend to get a little noisy and could be bothersome (especially if you’re a light sleeper), so if you have the option, ask for rooms that do not face the street. There’s a rooftop pool where you can take a plunge after a long day of shopping or sightseeing in the sweltering Singapore heat – and, maybe toss back a couple cocktails to complete the whole R&R therapy. The hotel’s beginning to show its age, so a little sprucing up might be necessary. Other than that, it meets expectations as a Hilton brand and you certainly cannot beat the impeccable location, so this one gets a ‘recommended’.

Reviews.Title: “good location on a busy road”
Reviews.Author: IVegas
Reviews.Content: Currently staying for 4 days at this Hilton on Orchard Road. Very busy traffic during holiday season with Christmas decorations all over. Only 5 minutes or so walk to the nearest MTR station (Orchard) and from there can access many tourists favorites (Little India, Chinatown, City Financial Districts where the Quays are). Internet for a charge at the hotel is Sin $ 6/15 minutes. Cheaper next door at the Far East Center for $1.80/15 minutes or $6/hr. Even cheaper in Little India $2/hr or less. 7-11, McDonalds, Starbucks, California Pizza Kitchen etc are all close by. Big mall (Ion) where MTR station is are all within 5-10 minutes walking. If one like non western food, little food court right across Hilton under 7-11. Straight pass that same building there is a 24 hrs market (Jason's). All in all very convenient. Room is nice size with all usual amenities. Staff service is very attentive. Tried their breakfast buffet pretty decent with different ethnic stations. However there are other choices outside of hotel that have more selections and less price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: The location is simply fantastic. Whether one is for business or for doing shopping, the hotel is located very central to major attractions and venues. The rooms, however, look tired and would need major renovations. While everything has been clean and functioning, the furniture and the general atmosphere was not up to the standard of a 5-star property. There is wi-fi in the lobby and in the rooms, the connectivity was not reliable and occasionally, the power of the signal was minimal. The breakfast was OK, many fruits, but more pastries would have been a nice touch. A word of cautious: even on weekends, the breakfast ends at 10:00. Overall, a good place for a short stay if the price is right. For a price of 150 EUR, one can get a better option in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Not really "HILTON"”
Reviews.Author: AW-EthNic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Singapore Hilton from 10th-13th Sept 2010 after reading most of the positive reviews from TA. After about 4 hours drives, we finally arrives at the Hilton at about 8am.The frontdesk lady was very helpful and the check-in was very smooth. Later, when we wanna to drives out, the exit bar won't open- intercom the hotel operator, then only open after asking us a few stupid questions (ie. are u a hotel guest, room no.........). Ceiling near the bathroom's leaking, when the maintenence guys in our room to checked, unable to fix it immediately and it's already 11pm, and we are tired so he called the manager on duty ( if i am not mistaken his name is Prasanna) to comeover to our room settling the matter. No offers from him until we have to personally ask for a room changed and with a NOT so happy face he said ok and then only telling us we can go to the VIP lounge the next day as a compliments from Hilton. Next, we received a notices for "AIRCOND SERVICING" stating aircond will be out from 11pm till 6am the next morning. ( A REPUTABLE 5star hotel, right????). Breakfast very good- plenty of varieties. The first day until the last day of our stays, we needs to press the intercom button to ask them to open the exit bar for us each time when we wanted to exit from the hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - very central”
Reviews.Author: PrincessChilli
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Very central to everything. The breakfast was delicious. The nicest thing that happened was the friendly greeting we received when our taxi pulled up. I think the gentleman' name was Ismalin (not sure if this is right spelling). The check in was very quick and all the staff in the foyer were brilliant. They helped us with sightseeing and we were able to book a bus (Luxury Coaches which were fantastic) from Singaporet to Malacca and were picked up from our hotel and taken to the bus station. Our room was great and the when we left the same gentleman came out and said Goodbye to us and remembered our names without looking them up. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Singapore - Great Hotel, Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Oldham5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights to ease the long journey from Sydney to London and wow what a hotel it was, i cannot understand how people can moan about this hotel the location was awsome right in the heart of Orchard Road where everything was happening and the hotel as a whole offered everything i needed for a memorable stay. Reception, internal shops, dining room, hotel room, gym and swimminig pool on the roof were all of a very good standard. The staff were very friendly and helpful and even pressed the button on the lift/elevator for you which i couldnt get over. lol. I will certainly stay at this hotel again if i stop over on my way back to Sydney and advise anyone who wants a good clean hotel in a great location to stay here. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton and great location”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend in Singapore Hilton. The location of the hotel is on Orchad road just opposite to the towers where you can find many bars... The hotel room was very nice and comfortable with a large desk, flat screen and king size bed. Just the bathroom was quiet small with no separate shower. But it's all in all a very good standard Hilton hotel. The breakfast buffet is very nice with a large choice of meals. I also had the opportunity to test the Sunday brunch included oysters, lobsters, Sunday roast... Next to the hotel you can find many shops open 24 hours like Seven (if you need some drinks) or Mc Donalds.

Reviews.Title: “Eggs”
Reviews.Author: said2151
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean, good service. Buffet breakfast was spoiled by the use of powdered egg instead of real scrambled egg. What a shame ! Staff were not sure whether food was halal or not . Wifi available as an expensive extra. These days it should be included free.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: INM30
Reviews.Content: great location , luxury room good serves in the heart of ORCHARD ROAD

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!!”
Reviews.Author: vitomarmam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights, booked 2 deluxe room with a VERY reasonable price through a travel agent. I got upgraded into the deluxe plus room. The room was modern and comfortable, small bathroom but still okay, the bed extremely comfortable, spacious room, LCD TV, single sofa, glass work desk, drawer, and minibar. The staff was good for hotel in Singapore, the concierge staff is very helpful, the housekeeping staff clean our room and usually come by at 6pm to offer a towel change or linen change which i think it was very good. The negative point about this hotel are the small size swimming pool, the breakfast is tasteless, and the lobby is really small it is not so Hilton (the boutique area is bigger than the lobby area).

Reviews.Title: “Hilton in Name Only!”
Reviews.Author: ksiddel
Reviews.Content: This review will primarily be helpful to Hilton Honors members. As a Gold or Diamond member you should receive; Free Room Upgrade, Free Late Check Out, Free internet, Free Access to the Executive Lounge. Room Upgrade: Upon arrival we were told that we had been “upgraded”. After exploring the room and property a bit we found that “upgraded” meant they had put us one floor higher. Not the executive floor mind you just one floor higher than they had planned on putting us. Was the room bigger? NO Better TV? NO. Balcony perhaps? NOPE After doing some checking to verify they were NOT full I talked with the assistant manager who reluctantly moved us to an upgraded room on the 22nd floor (executive floor) Save yourself some time and just insist upon that floor when you check in. Executive Lounge: The lounge is there on the 22nd floor but the problem is that you will need a reservation to use it. The lounge is VERY small and mostly two couches and some chairs. Guests who have stayed here before know to go before 6pm and reserve a seat or two or three or four or five etc. This means no matter what time you go between 6pm and 8:30pm there will be no place to sit, stand or even get a drink. They won’t let you in the lounge unless you have a place to sit. They tell you to go back to your room and wait until they call you. Two of the nights we were there we saw one guest occupying a couch and two chairs for hours. Another night we walked in to find everything reserved even though the guests were not around. The manager says he knows it is a problem but won’t offer a solution. If you plan on using the lounge go at 5:30-5:45 and stake out you spot. Late Check out: I called for late check out our last day but was told that it was not available. I receieved two calls after that wanting to know what time I was leaving. They want you out early! The funny thing is the next day when we did checked out we noticed that our bill didn’t clear and our room was cleaned until after the late check out time we requested. We waited after check out time in the executive lounge for our car to the airport. Turns out once the hotel check out time is over your card no longer works and you cannot get to the executive lounge without an escort. This Hilton has a great location and some nice staff but the management (who when I asked admitted he had never stayed in a Hilton hotel as guest) is inept!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RajaramS
Reviews.Content: Nice location, in the centre of the city. Keeps up to the Hilton standards. Service could be better and a little more personalised. Did not get the choice of room I opted for. Had to make do with another type of room. Otherwise OK. They did have an Indian Veg Set menu on their room service. That was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid Hilton in the best location in town”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: We stay here regularly when the rates are good. As we are Platinum Hilton honours we always get upgraded and enjoy the benefits of the Executive Lounge. They serve a top French Bordeaux and also a champagne, and are very generous in coming around with refills. Good quality food and lots of choice. Rooms pretty large with excellent bed/bedding, glass-top desk, comfortable chair and good lighting throughout. Bathrooms standard marble, but an improvement on the pre-renovation one! If you're here on Sunday, try the Champagne Brunch. Also, for the ladies, a top on-site hairdresser, Gerald Kong. And of course, the location is enviable - walk to all shopping and taxis always available outside. If you are into the Hilton chain, this one should not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton class and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Crazy33Italy
Reviews.Content: I must say I am always happy with the Hilton chain wherever I go. As soon as we arrived we were upgraded to the Executive Floor and the room was huuuuuuge! The flat screen TV was sooo nice, lots of channels and the furniture looked brand new. The bathroom was small for an executive room but I can’t complain at all, it had everything you needed. There were boiler and coffee, tea, decaf, sugar, sweetener, 2 bottles of free water provided per day. We had breakfast included and it is soooo worth it! It is great! There is even a juice station with fresh pineapple, melon, etc. juices made in front of you! There is an omelette station and a Chinese section with dim sums, noodles, etc. I was able to avoid eating for the rest of the day and just walk around Singapore! Orchard Rd is a shopper’s paradise! I have never seen so many shopping centres in my life! We did check out the Marina and it is nice but very crowded. Next time I go to Singapore I would probably stay at the Marina, but it would be difficult to beat the Hilton price and convenience in Orchard Rd. It is so easy to get around with the MRT, just 2 minutes walk from the Hilton which takes you to the Marina in 2/3 stops. And lots of nice restaurants in Orchard Rd too. Being a Hilton Honours Member we were granted permission to stay in our room until 4.00pm, which was very convenient as our plane wasn't due to depart Singapore until that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, barely 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Snack2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the regular deluxe room and had a small room with an even smaller toilet which looked really old. The airconditioning system was under servicing on the night I stayed (no advanced warning when I booked or checked in, just a letter on the desk) and so there was no airconditioning the whole entire night. Unbelievable huh. The pool area which was just renovated was tiny. There were just a few lounge chairs without any umbrellas and minimal foliage, which gave the place a very industrial look. The check-in counter staff were friendly enough but the concierge staff (2 I met) were brusque and unfriendly. Very unlike the other Hilton hotels I've stayed in around the world. Definitely not worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “great location and decent value, just don't eat breakfast here!”
Reviews.Author: KayTravelsAgain
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Hilton; generic and pretty soulless BUT it has a fantastic location! It's a 5 min walk from Orchard MRT and the new ION shopping mall. Also only a $5 taxi ride away from the botanical gardens. I'm sure the breakfast is fine (typically Hilton: a good choice but overpriced) however you are a stones throw aways from so many other great places to eat that unless you are rushed or on business I would really reccomend venturing out. Toast at Takashimaya is lovely, also the Starbucks towards the MRT has free wi-fi. Overall the rooms are nice, a decent size and the french fries through room service for those late night munchies are fab. The rooftop swimming pool is also good for socking up some rays or just somewhere quiet to read a book.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ranlew
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hilton Singapore at 6.00am and were greeted by friendly porters and receptionist. We were alloted our room upon registration and we were given permission to occupy the room at 6.30am. Whilst at the time of registration we didn't feel tired, when we entered our room and saw the bed, we suddenly felt so very tired after a long flight. We were extremely grateful for the Hilton for giving us the room so early. The room we occupied was a King Executive Suite with plenty of room to move around. The room was what we were expecting. It was very clean and well appointed. There were a few minor problems with the room upon arrival, but these issues were attended to immediately by a well mannered Maintenance Engineer. Being a Hilton Honours Member we were granted permission to stay in our room until 4.00pm, which was very convenient as our plane wasn't due to depart Singapore until 9.00pm that evening. All in all, an excellent hotel and we will definately stay here again. Well done Hilton Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict249
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Singapore in July 2009, booked this hotel at a reasonable price check in was quick and easy . Once we had arrived in our room we were delightfully surprised clean spacious and all that we needed. Breakfast was good and had lots to offer. Pool area was small but on the rooftop so could see views of the city. Staff were so delightful would definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stays”
Reviews.Author: Imro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore and in between we travelled to KL and Phuket. For the first part we had a Executive plus room and the second part after returning from Phuket a standard Executive room. During KL trip we kept the room. Checkin was very quick on the executive floor (level 22) Our bags were brought upstairs immediatly. We arrived in the hotel at 6AM and they allowed us to checkin early as checkin normally is at 14:00 PM. Good service Room was spacious with a nice balcony (normal exec room did not have a balcony and was a bit smaller). Bathroom nice with good ammenities, but could be a bit bigger. Comfortable bed,and nice tv altough not a wide selection of western channels but this is a minor detail. Executive room comes with access to a lounge were they provide drinks and a selection of luxury snacks from 18:00 to 20.30. Also in this lounge you have a concierge for all your needs. Level 1 breakfast in Checkers Brasserie was very good with Indian, Japanese, Chinese and western brekfast selection, plus fruits, cereals etc. On sunday there is a brunch which has a lot of choices but a bit pricy starting at 85 SGD. Hotel itself is in a very good location on Orchard Road with just 2 minutes walk to Orchard MRT and plenty of eating options and supermarkets. Staff very friendly and helpfull. Overall I had a good stay and will return if going when going to singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: A little older, but still very elegant. Great location for the Metro (SMRT) and shopping. Convenient to everything. Highly recommended and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: Silviadnc
Reviews.Content: I've been at Hilton Hotel in Singapore and I simply loved it! The Hotel is amazing, and people is really kind. I'm in love with Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KAKABURA
Reviews.Content: This is one of those few hotels where your glass cannot be even half empty, because moment it is you would have somebody who would come in and try to refill it. Amazing service, great location great experience. Singapore's an expensive hotel destination but i will recommend this hotel for its service and location. The rooms are a little on the older side but you would not notice them at all. Well furnished My No1 Hotel in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “location, location...”
Reviews.Author: hp1212
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is usually priced similarly to its sister Singapore hotel located away from the center: one is a very good hotel, the other is a very well located hotel... This hotel's main asset is without a doubt its location right on Orchard Road, with countless shopping and eating opportunities on the doorstep. The hotel itself is a somewhat older building without much character. Rooms have been brought up to contemporary standards and are comfortable enough. I accidentally got to watch housekeeping in action, and could not help but notice how little time was spent per room compared to some other parts of Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Remains very good, pool out til next month”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: A further stay here for one night. Remains very good, breakfast buffet a feature. Good service etc. The pool is out of action until September 2010. Swimming can be organized at a nearby club at no cost. Gym etc still in action.

Reviews.Title: “If you are in singapore make this hotel a first choice !!”
Reviews.Author: GoldieMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HILTON for a night and I thought i could have stayed there for a day or two more!! This is simple and elegant hotel in line with brand HILTON ; superb location at ORCHARD ROAD, just walk arround till late and enjoy lighting , pubs and food. Rooms are nice, good atmosphere overall in this four star property. Charges are bit high but its Singapore !!! Wether you are alone or with family this hotel is good for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Gifu
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid (from bidding), it was great value for such a good location, steps from good food and shopping on Orchard Rd. Newton Food Centre is nearby. The room looks modern and we like that. Bathroom was small, only had a tub and no separate shower. Amenities were useful and plenty. Internet wasn't free which was disappointing since even the Hilton Garden Inn offers free internet. The room was clean and bed was comfy, but the pillows were too soft. Although we enjoyed our stay, this hotel felt more like a 4-4.5* hotel. Since we were facing Orchard Rd, we could hear cars from our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: darshi777
Reviews.Content: The purpose of staying in this hotel was a short business trip. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights / 3 days. The best thing that I liked about this hotel is its extraordinary service and absolutely pure vegetarian food. The chef really treated me well by cooking special food for me alone. I would stay in the same hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Mirror74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days at the end of July 2010. Even as I am Gold HH member I was not upgrated, and even not granted access to the lounge. The clerk just offered free breakfast or free internet option, and we (party of 3) choose free breakfast, but at the end had to pay breakfast for the third member of our party, since the clerk failed to mention, that the "free" offer is valid only for two people. And breakfast is more than 40 SGD,... Otherwise, we were not very satisfied with the hotel (comming from Hilton Kuala Lumpur you can really see the difference in service!), for example our room was on the second day cleaned only at 4.00pm,... The rooms are quite small. Pool was closed during our stay because of renovation, but no alternative was offered at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location at Orchard street”
Reviews.Author: BSFTL
Reviews.Content: Located at Orchard Street near several major shopping complexes the Hilton Singapore in general provides service and standards you can expect from a property like this. However, our stay was influenced by works affecting the pool area which is no need to worry if planning sight seeing most of the day as we did. Any information on the website would be helpful in any way. Doing paint works in the rooms is without doubt necessary from time to time. But if the hotel cannot assure that those smells caused by those activities do not affect the sold bedrooms, we think this not very popular towards the guests. As my husband was HiltonHHonors Gold elite member at that time, we asked for an upgrade. This was denied as the hotel was fully booked, ok. But giving away such a room which forced us to move the floor the next day is below expectation staying in a Hilton.
