OK, the room (both rooms) was refurbished and looked bright and fashioned, which was nice. Breakfast was a pleasure. There was so much to choose from, even really huge options of Asian delights. The next MTR station is Orchard, a five minutes walk on Orchard. More customer care the next time will likely lead to a better review.

Reviews.Title: “Luxrary stay”
Reviews.Author: dhayatadak
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hilton at Singapore is a luxary hotel at Orchid road. This hotel have very good serivice & food is very good quality. The people from any part of world can stay & enjoy theire journy in this hotel. The hotel staff is very co-operative & i am happy with theire services.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable - will saty here again”
Reviews.Author: mytravelthoughts
Reviews.Content: i wasn't expecting much from the hilton but i found it very comfortable. room was of a high standard and was cleaned well throughout. staff were friendly and other services like the laundry were reliable and fast (although a bit pricey , but that's to be expected) above all, i think the location is excellent. Orchard road with all its shopping centres and restaurants is on your doorstep and the mtr and several bus routes are accessible closeby. These are exactly what you need when in singapore. The hotel brasserie food was tasty but overpriced. This was handy when needed but there are so many other places within easy reach, you do not need to rely on this. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price, Quality, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: dutseal
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly deserves the # 18 rank out of 228. The lobby was super nice, the staffs were super friendly and courteous. The room? Excellent big size, nice flat panel tv, super clean (but small) restroom. The KING sized BED was the largest king size compared to the one when we stayed at the Four Seasons Singapore hotel or the Marriott Singapore Hotel. The linen was crisp white and simple but elegant. The glass desk was contemporary cool. The arm chair was old looking but comfy still. The best was the king size bed. This size is different from the regular US king size bed. It is much wider. Best of all, you can just walk across from the hotel and there is a bus stop that goes alongside Orchard road and the MRT station is right in front near the Marriott hotel. So very very easy to get around. All you can eat breakfast buffet was only SGD 38 per person, which is cheap for a hotel this caliber. We had room # 1511 and we loved it. All the soap and shampoo were from Crabtree & Evelyn. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great! perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, out of all the hotels in the same price range, i would recommend Hilton as your best bet. Location is Great, Buffet breakfast is AMAZING, (continental, oriental, indian, healthy stuff - special K range and all the fruits that you can imagine) Room is a bit on the small side, not a typical classic hilton, more on the minimalist sude... but they have just been renovated, so all is great. Bathroom amenities are all Crabtree and Evelyn, with bath salts and all... Towels are especially fluffy and white... excellent! Service is wonderful, from the door man, to the room service. All is wonderful, except that it's 2010 now, I think we all deserve free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury in the city”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1976
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel was fantastic. The staff were so helpful and polite. The rooms were beautiful, bed was massive, bathroom stunning and almost didn't want to leave the room! There are several shops in the hotel lobby, all too expensive for my budget though unfortunately! Location was brilliant on Orchard Road right in the middle of everything. Very clean city. The pool was huge, towels are supplied by the gym reception but don't leave them on sunbed for too long, they will be removed. Didn't have breakfast here, but within 30 seconds walk each side of the hotel are cafes that all serve breakfast at a very reasonable price. Felt safe walking about at all hours of the day and night think it helps we were on the main stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Located in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dori-DD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton for a couple of nights in April 2010. We selected this Hotel as my husband is a Hilton honors member and also because we got a good deal from asiatravel.com. However, we have visited Singapore more than 7 times and this was not our first trip. The hotel is located in a good area - close to the shops. It was also easy to get taxis. The staff were not that great and did not go out of their way to provide good customer care. The room was good - it looks like the photos on the internet. The bed was comfortable and I went to sleep immediately after the check-in! The breakfast is the standard hilton fare and it was nothing exceptional. As I am a vegetarian, it was the same food everyday. We also ordered room service. Although the food was not too bad - there is not much selection. We had to order more dishes as they did not understand what we had ordered earlier! Overall, it is a good place to stay - esp. if you are in Singapore for business and if you need to go shopping. We would stay here again if we get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Treciadiene
Reviews.Content: excellent stay! honestly, i stayed in few Hilton family hotels around the world, and i have to say that Singapore is excellent! everything from the door, to the door was excellent! doesn;t matter you have standart room or suite, they will treat you the same as everybody!!!! i stayed in deluxe room,, it was really nice spacious room on 14th floor. Have had very good sleep and very good stay! Especially big thank you for breakfast team! you guys are amazing! Breakfast are the highest standarts! i got my orange juice, and i was asked to top it up, then i got my tea and my first cup was poured! as it should be! well done and big thank you! i would recommend this hotel to stay. Some things are a bit overprices, but it;s because it is hilton, just go and eat somewhere out:) well done again! and i will definately come there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, unbelievable service”
Reviews.Author: A.Jalan
Reviews.Content: had stayed here many years ago, yet within half a day of getting there the entire staff knew our names(wife and I) and went out of their way to make us comfortable including giving us some clever tips on cabs, eating etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced old hotel”
Reviews.Author: vs123456
Reviews.Content: Definitely not worth the price and my client was paying corporate rates which are half the normal rates. Very old hotel. Rooms hadnt been renovated in a very long time. The restaurants were overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room and service”
Reviews.Author: fluster
Reviews.Content: First class service from the staff who are helpful AND sincere which most hotels don't manage. The standard of the room is fantastic, I don't I;ve ever been in a better bed with better (or bigger) pillows. I had to call twice to have my room service tray removed one evening and the guy couldn't have been more apologetic. I even got some chocolates as an apology! I wouldn;t hesitate to book this hotel again. It can be hard to get a taxi at rush hour (applies to whole of Singapore).

Reviews.Title: “The Creme de la creme of the hotel world”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverMartyn
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, you can't help but be astounded by the personal and amazing service which is offered by the staff at this hotel. Everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant. This was our second stay in this hotel and will be sure to visit it again- everything was wonderful. The hotel reception staff gave us an upgrade to an executive room, which was luxurious and had everything we hoped for. The decor in the hotel is plush and glamorous - very clean and the room was gorgeous. Despite being in a bustling city, inside this hotel you felt separated from the chaos of the outside world; the pool, food and room all greatly contributed to a fantastic holiday. The hotel definitely reflected Singapore as a city - modern, chic and extremely welcoming - I wouldn't hestitate to stay here again. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellelt - hotel .”
Reviews.Author: Rondun
Reviews.Content: That said, the property is long overdue for an interior makeover (they had spent time working outside). The main public space as well, but the rooms are dated, especially the narrow, 70-style bathroom .even on the executive floor, where - as was another note . there is no other especially for regular rooms. The floor staff room on the Exec is amazing, but its main hall ,small selection of beverages, no computers and other benefits are few EF makes it difficult to justify the extra cost , not as in KL Hilton - where the sub is really worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer32
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location on the Orchard Road, SIngapore's main shopping district. The hotel room was clean, however was slightly smaller than we were expecting for the price. The hotel has a rooftop pool which we used a couple of times and a gym. Overall in terms of value for money, you are definitely paying for the Hilton brand and the location at this hotel, however we would recommend it if you are looking for a prime shopping location in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hospitality yet again by Singapore Hilton. Exceptionally friendly service helped to make our stay very enjoyable and got our holiday off to a perfect start. Well located near the big shopping centers, this is a perfect base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: DiDiYambaNSW
Reviews.Content: Service A1...Room A1...Staff A1......Food A1...Locality A1...I cannot reccomend this Superb Hotel highly enough......THANK YOU Hotel Singapore for making my week's holiday SO memorable....

Reviews.Title: “Good but there is better in the area”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: A difficult review to write. I stayed here once with my husband and son last year. My husband has stayed a number of times on business and at various other Singapore hotels. I have waited to review until our travelling to Singapore finished and I was able to compare to other hotels in Singapore. Overall our impression would be that this is a good hotel but there are better for the price. The staff are excellent and tracked down a suitcase that we had left at the airport. Service was always friendly and efficient. Location for shops, touring etc is ideal. Other services were good but often bettered elsewhere. Breakfast buffet was fine but every day the waffles were burned, then the manager took a hand and we had excellent waffles, the next day they were back to cold and burned. Pool was pleasant Rooms were fine but cleaning could have been improved. Overall this hotel is good and I am sure a stay would be very enjoyable. I would be quite happy to stay here again but by choice I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Choice for location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: veteranworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: we just came back from a lengthy trip through europe and on to s.e. asia and vietnam, with two 2 night stops at the Singapore Hilton as a travel base. we were also here for two visits about 1.5 years ago, so i guess with 8 recent nights we can give a reasonably accurate description of the place. i must admit i really laughed at a recent view that everyone including man and dog seemed to be admitted to the exec lounge. now, in all 8 nights we stayed there, always in exec rooms, we did occasionally see the lounge busy at the expected times, peak breakfast and early evening cocktail hour, but we never came in when there wasn't a table available, or when the staff seemed overwhelmed. in fact, the lounge staff are always trying to please you, whether it's bringing you a drink or food or helping with local info or airline reservations. but when the same review griped because he could only see trees and buildings on the orchard road side, well, what does he think is located on orchard road?? if he had the other view toward the other side of the hotel he would be looking at more trees and other buildings!! i wish people would try to objectively stick to a hotel and it's good and bad points, instead of letting unrelated personal gripes or impressions get in the way. back to the hotel, we found the value of the exec room with lounge, excellent breakfast with different stuff each day, free wireless internet in the lounge, to be well worth the rather minor extra cost. ample comments have been made about the rooms... i remember years ago when they were really mediocre, so the new rooms really seem great to me. are they huge? no, but the furnishings are attractive, light and friendly colors, great flat screen TVs with a decent channel selection. we also ate twice at the ground level bistro restaurant and had very good food and service. singapore is a city with many top notch hotels fighting to be top dog, but to be fair, the level of service in all deluxe hotels tends to be very high. the Hilton deserves to be among the upper echelon of this group. as many have mentioned, the orchard location is hard to beat. however, with all the action springing up down at the marina area, with the spectacular new casino open and the River Walk nearby, those who are not Hilton addicts may want to check things out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mediocre Club Floor”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorafrica
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent 4 nights on the Club Floor at the Hilton Singapore at the end of March. The location is fantastic. It is on Orchard Road, within walking distance of lots of shops, restaurants, etc. We checked in at the Club Lounge, which was very easy, and were then shown to our room on the 18th Floor. We were given a room with a view of Orchard Road, but all we could see were some trees, and other buildings. The room is well appointed with a very comfortable bed, plasma TV screen, work desk and nominal wardrobe space. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. We had access to the Club lounge, which it seemed that every man and his dog had access to as well. The first night we went to grab a drink, the lounge was packed. There was no seating room at all so we left. Over the 4 nights, we had drinks there once as it was so busy. Even at breakfast it was a busy lounge. The staff were friendly and courteous. During the day there were snacks and soft drinks as well as hot beverages available. There is free wifi in the lounge. Overall it was a reasonable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on my way home to Sydney from London. Chose to stay at The Hilton as I found a great advance purchase deal on the Hilton website. Much like many people have already commented – the hotel itself has been around for like 30-40 years and recent renovations haven’t really covered the years all too well. My room was big and bright and the bed was massive and really comfortable. The furnishings were new and modern and had the room renovations been completed to a better standard, would have made the room look quite slick. Bathroom was pretty average, a throw back of the 80’s I think. The room comes with the most complimentary items I’ve seen from any hotel – toothbrushes and mouthwash right down to shoe polish – they really have covered everything! No entertainment system, just a few local and western satellite channels. The included breakfast was the standard Hilton fare – good selection of Western and Asian food and operated late so you could sleep in and not miss it. The pool area on the roof was quite nice but the bar area was closed for renovation when I was there. Best thing about the Hilton Singapore is the location. Right in the middle of the action on Orchard Road near the Scotts Road intersection. Location really can’t be beat if you’re looking for easy access to eats, shopping and transport. Overall stay was pleasant enough but not sure I’d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: Location, hospitality, and a quality executive lounge made for a wonderful experience at this hotel. After traveling around most of Singapore I can say I made the correct choice in selecting the Hilton Singapore. The location on Orchard Road is an outstanding advantage. The MRT is easy to access, although just a bit of a walk, but once you have it down it is an easy walk pass underground shops. All things considered I am pleased with my choice of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: cool_smile
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great, had great time roaming around orchard street . their service was the best. had stayed for 3 days , travel desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better”
Reviews.Author: Superbuyer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with some good points including: great location for upscale shopping, friendly staff, quite & clean rooms, with one of the better Hilton breakfasts. But it does have a few bad points: very small rooms with a complete lack of décor (stayed in an Executive room), Executive lounge is far too small for the number of people who use it (especially at night), expensive Internet. It tries to be an upscale property but it just come across as being expensive but really not unique or special.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights, wont stay again. Singapore has many many great hotels, this is not one of them. Room was small, ceiling light fittling vibrated noisely even after 2 calls to front desk to repair, breakfast buffet just ok, lobby small and not enticing, no smoking area and not allowed in front of hotel - have to go onto street where there are lots of nightwalkers due to Orchard Towers opposite... On the positive side tho, I believe the club level is good. The rooftop pool area is sparce but nice (no lift to top floor, 1 flight of stairs up from gym level). The location on Orchard is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dryus
Reviews.Content: i love the hotel in all aspect from room to the location. Very...very happening and lots of things to see & to do... great...great location and plenty of choices for shopping and dining. it is at the center of orchard road, the most popular shopping area. so much activities around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: SKDMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Orchard street which is the heart of the city with excellent shopping & food nearby. The staff was very friendly & always ready to help with any travel arrangements. The executive lounge offers free internet which is good if u wanna check yr mails quickly even when on vacation. Overall the location is so good that I would highly recommend this property to businesss/ leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, rooms a little small.”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Beautifully situated, easy access to business district by taxi and to underground. Well priced compared to other hotels. Excellent breakfast. Rooftop swimming pool, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: deanie756
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a deluxe twin bed non smoking room. Good size room and quiet with every-thing to make your stay very comfortable. The room had a safe, daily crabtree and evelyn toiletries, dressing gown and slippers, tea and coffee and iron etc. The bathroom was modern and clean with a bath tub and high pressure shower. The location is great for all bus and train routes and obviously the shopping. The breakfast has a delicious and large selection to choose from for all tastes, chinese, full english, fruit, cheese and breads etc. The swimming pool is kept very clean and has lovely views with comfortable sunloungers. Personal and friendly service from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelGsCambridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what you would expect from an upscale Hilton - impecably clean, well furnished, good facilities, nice executive lounge - all good Excellent location, easy walk to restaurants and shops Would definitely use this hotel again next time I am in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “great location, I will definitely come back again.”
Reviews.Author: s0lmaz
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed a lot from the first moment .really polite and helpful staff. the room was very clean and bright and had kettle and tea and coffee for free and safety box and iron which i appriciate the most :-) .The bed was very comfortable and big.there was a 40 inch flat screen tv and you could attach any kind of media to it. breakfast was acceptable .it was not extraordinary.the location was superb. the hotel was located in orchard . there were so many malls and big shops and it was the best place you could walk at night. right next to the hotel(when you come out on the left hand) there is a little kiosk in the name of SHIRAZ that sells delicious sandwiches( shawerma). on the right hand there is a shopping center(FAREAST) you can find a fair exchange there. again on the right when you reach to a crossroad you will sea ION shopping center where you can find a 8 store mall . and you can ride on MRT to any spot in singapore . if any body wants more information can ask me.the pool was on the roof , spite it was not big it was really clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lunar New Year at the Singapore Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: Early check-in was a snap at 9 a.m. Warmly greeted as a Diamond and given an overview of executive floor benefits. Executive lounge is fantastic, with excellent food and beverage. Nice gym, rooftop pool (bar area under upgrading), nicely remodeled rooms with a surprising amount of space. Connected via walkway to Four Seasons. Orchard Road location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best All round Hilton we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Sidabbey
Reviews.Content: We stayed a whole week with 3 children for a vacation. Upgraded to Executive room with Lounge access and this made all the difference. Highlights were excellent location, breakfast and courteous service. Only downside was poor knowledge of whats on and when during the Chinese New Year week with some wrong information provided. However, overall we would rate this the best Hilton as the location and service with a smile is what you need on a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Lounge makes the stay more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: iwishiwasonvacation
Reviews.Content: Many of my reviews have been raving about the executive rooms. However, the Hilton Singapore, even with a small lounge does have a very strong team to make your stay most enjoyable. It gets especially crowded during evening cocktails when guests wish to get their moneys worth in drinks. Also, I think they need to be more strict with regards to children misbehaving in the lounge during meal service. The hotel is 40 years old, therefore I am not complaining about its size. However, what I am displeased with is that you do not receive complimentary in-room internet access even with an executive room. Shangri-La Hotels offers this in ALL rooms, why shouldn't the Hilton? The lounge shuts at 2300hrs and so does the internet service. Very unfortunate if you are hit with jetlag after a transcontinental flight. The hotel is worth staying at when there is a good deal on offer. Otherwise, for the same rate you can find a better deal at other hotels along the Orchard Road stretch and even beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: NickypKent
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The service from the staff was exceptional, very polite and attentive. We had a lovely room which was spacious and comfortable. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: While the service is good and the rooms are clean there are plenty of better hotel choices in Singapore with better location. Being right across the street from the notorious "orchard tower" makes the neighborhood a little seedy. It's OK if your racking up the Hilton points but otherwise stay closer to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Avoid the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: raindropsonroses
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights in early January with my parents. Hotel was in a great location on Orchard Rd, so it was very close to the department stores and MRT. Room was pretty standard. The swimming pool was clean, though a bit on the small side. We didn't have breakfast included in our rate, but we decided to pay for breakfast on the first day, which we did not repeat again. There was a good selection of food, but a lot it was cold or lukewarm. The staff did not seem to be concerned about replenishing the food when it got cold. This was rather disappointing as we had previously enjoyed really good breakfasts at other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and decidedly average.”
Reviews.Author: macn0tts
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights, and by the end of the visit I was ready to leave. In theory it should be good given it's location and name, but it fails to live up to expectations. From a service perspective, everything is a bit of an issue / challenge. (Had a real battle to get two shirts pressed within a two hour time frame - "minimum express time is four hours sir") Stayed on the "executive floor" at a higher rate, and it appears that so did everyone else at the hotel, as it was virtually impossible to get a table at breakfast or in evening. Pool area, whilst nice, has a woeful lack of chairs / loungers, and no real towel change service. Filled in a comments card and left it for manager halfway through the stay - never heard anything back, which kind of says it all as far as service is concerned. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average and ordinary”
Reviews.Author: rantati7
Reviews.Content: Hilton Singapore is as standard as you can get in the four or five star hotel category. No surprises, nothing to rage about. All is just as one would expect. Build in the 70’s the age shows especially in the public areas despite the recent tries to hide most of the bad design of the era. Note that the work to renew the rooms is still ongoing – in mid-February 2010, I booked the stay using HHonors points for two nights. At the reception they however booked me in for one night only. To sort this out required four visits back to reception. Obviously once they booked you in it was next to impossible to have the reservation corrected in their systems. Location Located on the Orchard Road just a few hundred metres from the Orchard and Scott crossing Hilton is ideally located especially for shopping – the most favourite past time of this shoppaholic nation. Arrive in Singapore during weekend and the shopping centres on Orchard Road as packed as they can ever be. To access the MRT you’ll first need to walk to Orchard and Scotts crossing and then go underground. And underground in Singapore means of course going through a shopping centre. Finding your way in this underground maze is as confusing as it can get. And at busy times the underground passage is extremely crowded. If you are in Singapore for shopping this location gets my full five points. However in relation to other activities in Singapore this location is worth 3,5 points. Public areas The hotel has seen lately a facelift – trying to get rid of the 70’s. It’s however in the public areas that the age shows. The lobby has no wow factor which some many other major hotels in Singapore have. It’s adequate for its purpose and at the same time very ordinary. Enter one of elevators and you are brought back in time to when this hotel was build. Even though they’ve tried to hide the age – the plastic surgeon has not done a very good job. It’s as if the facelift was done in hurry and with bad workmanship. E.g. in the corridors the doors have been covered with cherry wood imitation laminate but leaving the “hand rails” in the corridors to their original “glory”. An average sized pool is located on the roof top. The elevator will take you to 23rd floor from where it’s one more floor to climb up to the pool level. The pool is dated – build as if the pool is something a hotel must have. Big plus however for the opening hours: the pool is open until ten o’clock in the evening. In relation to other similar properties I give only 2 points for the public areas. It would be 3 if the plastic surgeon hadn’t failed so miserably. Room Rooms at Hilton are a somewhat different story than the public areas even though there are shortcomings here as well. Recently refurbished, nearly all the dark wood panelling removed (the wardrobe doors are still the old ones) and replaced with light wood furniture and fittings the rooms are ... well... what you’d expect in a major hotel. No surprises yet again. Bathroom still has the original marble tiles and dark wood fitting but even there they’ve at least tried to bring the bathroom upto date by renewing the lighting fixtures and shower. New flat screen LDC TV – but the information system is as old as it can get. They’ve done here the same as elsewhere – just cosmetic improvements. There was something wrong the air-conditioning system. You could adjust the temperature but it actually had no effect on anything. During daytime temperature and humidity in the room rose despite the aircon. By morning the temperature was ok but as the sun rose the room became quickly too warm again. Additionally the sound proofing could be better. You can hear the traffic from the street. And in someone walks in the room up above you can both hear and feel it: at least in my room I could hear the foot steps and sense the trembling coming from upstairs. Which makes one wonder whether the building is earthquake proof. During my stay some maintenance work was still being carried out. The banging and drilling in my floor (17th) started by 9 o’clock in the morning and went on until 6 o’clock in the afternoon. For the room three points. Executive Lounge Located on the 22nd floor modernised Executive Lounge is possibly the best feature in this hotel. Serving breakfast and evening drinks with small bites for HHonors Gold members and those having paid for an Executive Room the Lounge has as well free wireless internet access. Service is swift, drinks and bite sized food plentiful. Better than in many other Hilton properties. Full five for the Executive Lounge. Service Yet again, trying hard but not quite getting there. I booked two nights stay with HHonors points. At the reception they managed to mix it up and only book me for one night. Had to go to the reception four times to sort the matter out. And even when it finally was corrected the original booking for one night only seemed to haunt in their systems and resulted in not cleaning the room during the first day, having no newspaper the second and so one. Small things but still they are the ones that make the difference. Otherwise the service is impeccable. Door men opening the doors, someone to order you the elevator etc etc. As a summary Average and ordinary in nearly all aspects, Hilton is a safe bet. It doesn’t match the top properties in Singapore but it is good still. The location is especially good is you are in for shopping. However the hotels on the other side of the Scotts Road (e.g. Marriott, Hyatt) are in a slightly better position as you do not have to cross Scotts Road.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Swissdiver
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not: I was not there for shopping but only for business. So I am less impressed by the location than others. This Hilton is a nice one although the building is rather old (but obviously renovated). Check in was quick and efficient. The room I was given was all right although I tend to dislike those windows that can't be open. My room was in the back of the hotel, facing the Four Season swimming pool and some trees. Hence it was rather calm in contrast to Orchard street on the other side... Room was well equipped and the bed, good. An iPod station would have however be appreciated. There is on the top floor a large swimming pool (a pleasure at the end of a working day...), just above the fitness. Breakfast were Hilton like, i.e. with a gorgeous buffet! Wifi fitness is available but at a cost (about USD 20 for 24 hours). Staff was nice and efficient as often in the area. All together this was a good experience. And yes, shopping is just there...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisamariepea
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. All of the staff were super friendly and always helpful. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, excellent service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: daisyherts
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel. The staff are so friendly and helpful. It is in an excellent location just over the road from the Hopper bus stop and within walking distance to the Botanical Gardens. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gbumaga
Reviews.Content: Stayed several days in this hotel during my recent business trip. Hotel is located right in the middle of shopping area, close to Metro, movies, restaurants, etc. The only negative (can be positive for some) that Orchard Towers (building full of bars and discos) is right across the street and there are bunch of street walkers hanging around it. Overall good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: gunnerHiltonHead_SC
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, accomodating concierge. Very nice room lacked only closet space. Pool needed more shady seating. Fabulous location. Be careful shopping--our legal farm raised crocodile purse was confiscated by US Customs who refused to accept the Singapore government certification of its legality.

Reviews.Title: “love it!!”
Reviews.Author: chinggu
Reviews.Content: Me n my family stayed there from Jan 6 to jan 9 '2010. We had 3 rooms. 2 are connected. We were worried that the hotel is a little bit far from the center of orchard, well we consider the center of orchard road is the takashimaya area. But we were wrong.. the hotel was a jump to Ion mall which is the newest mall with lots and lots of restaurant (1 open until 1 o'clock) and shops... The room was spacious, breakfast was great, consider that we got the rate at less than 200 sin it's a great one!! Very clean room and bathroom.. ah... bathroom amenities were from crabtree and evelyn sooo nice!!! The underground tunnel to cross the street is a little bit confusing but it doesn't matter. The hippobus stop just infront of the hotel across Hilton hotel, I forget the hotel name. or you can just walk a little to tang mal/marriot hotel and the hippobus wil pick up up there. As tourist or if you bring kids a 2 days pass of hippobus is a must!! you can go all over Singapore in a hop, even to Sentosa island. The 2 days ticket include the new flyer attraction, duck tour, night safari and many many more. Just love that hippobus!! Hiton also surprised us when we checkout by giving us a voucher to comeback for special rate of 150sin if am not wrong. Unfortunately its only valid for 3 months. With the overprices rate among orchard road hotels, Hilton is just a superb place to stay.. hope this help others!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal and unfriendly. Great location for shopping.”
Reviews.Author: jimbobWelsh
Reviews.Content: Traveling in Asia I have got used to really friendly laid back smiling staff. This may be a a whole culture shock with Singapore but I was taken aback with how unfriendly the staff were. The buffet was good and since I was looking for a western fix just the job. Room was quite small for a business hotel. It wasn't cheap so next time I will try somewhere else.if you are here for the shops you can't beat the location and I would recommend it on this basis.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent - the staff are professional, the service is brilliant and the rooms are smart and modern, I must say that the bathrooms could do with bringing up to the same level as the rooms, other than that I couldn't fault it. Great location on Orchard Rd, handy for all the shops and attractions, taxi's are cheap and at the tops it will cost you S$40 (£20). I have stayed in few hotels in Singapore and this was the most comfortable stay that we have had.

Reviews.Title: “An older renovated hotel, but with a location that really is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: GOPBI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (January 3, 2010) as this is our designated crew hotel for all layover crew stays while in Singapore. This hotel also hosts crews from several European and Middle East airlines. This hotels single best feature- above all- is its LOCATION; located on Singapore’s famed Orchard Road. It's literally right on one of the most famous streets in the country. You can easily walk the length of Orchard road or access either of the public transportation systems (bus or subway-MRT) from here. It’s opposite of the Royal Thai Embassy and within a few minutes walk from several key shopping locations such as Tang’s Plaza and Wisma Atria- to name just a few. The closest MRT station is Orchard station (NS22) and is less than a five-minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is a one of the older hotel properties in the greater Orchard area and has undergone some renovations. Most of the guest rooms have been recently refurbished and as well as most of the dining and beverage venues. But the hotel does show its age and structural limitations of an “older” property. Lobby / Check-in: As is normal, our rooms are pre-assigned and pre-paid, so there is little in the way of check-in formalities—only to distribute individual room keys. There is a separate check-in area for Hilton HHonors members. The hotel is shaped as a open centered rectangle with guest rooms along the perimeter of each floor. There are glass elevators on each end of the hotel. The lobby has an impressive view of the hotel and the upper floors. Room: I was assigned an “Executive” level room on the 16th floor. My room was done in mostly white, off-white and natural light wood colors giving it a noticeably cool and clean feel. The bed was a standard King size and was of a moderate firmness—a departure from the typical firmer beds that are prevalent in Asian hotels. Lots of pillows- both down and foam were provided and there was a light duvet. The room was also furnished with a nice medium size glass work desk with multi-phone and multi-power ports. Wireless internet access is available (for an extra charge or included wither higher room rates) Newer flat screen LCD TV with all typical local and international cable programming. There was a provisioned in-room coffee and tea set and stocked mini-bar (at typically high hotel rates). The windows are large with great views and well sound insulated and tinted to reduce the strong Singapore sun. Drapes are not “black-out” so those who are sensitive to light may find sleeping difficult after sunrise hours. Bathroom: My bathroom was a bit on a overall smaller side but still well equipped with a stand-up shower. The hot water ran hot and the pressure was excellent. There was a nice selection of house-label pre and post-bath toiletries. The mirror is not anti-fog, so you may have to wipe, but there is a magnification (make-up) mirror as well as a mini hair dryer. No bath robes provided. Hotel facilities and Amenities: The hotel has three traditional eateries- a seafood/grill, casual brasserie and a deli. In addition there is a “juice bar” and lounge. While the food looked good- and I’m sure it is; in a town like Singapore with all the excellent culinary options available and right at your doorstep, I have to recommend you eat outside. For leisure there is a large roof top pool complete with sun chairs and tables with sun umbrellas- given the roof-top location, it affords some good views of the Orchard area. You can order food and drink from here as well. The hotel has a smaller gym with basic exercise equipment and a modest selection of free weights. The business center can accommodate most all needs: copy/print/fax, computer use, basic secretarial and translation services are available. You can send/receive your FedEx, UPS and DHL packages here as well. It’s open 24/7 but after-hours you need to contact the Front Desk. Like most four and five star hotels they can accommodate your medical services, daycare/childcare and travel agent services needs on an as-needed basis. SUMMARY: This is a very good hotel for those wanting a hotel within easy walking distance to Orchard Road and it’s a very good hotel on its own merits. However, in the past few years a number of new hotels have opened in the greater area that exceed the Hilton in terms of spaciousness, amenities, design and service level and as such have raised the bar considerably. If you can book this hotel at a discount you’ll be getting a good overall value—again, with a location that truly is “second to none”, but without a large “wow” factor. PROS: Location, location and location. Quite simply, this place is hard to beat since it’s right at the beginning of Orchard Street—the highest profile shopping in all of Singapore. It’s also quite easy to catch local public transport (bus, subway, taxi) from here as well. The staff is typically quick and efficient and will to help—exuding Asian hospitality. Excellent food/drink venues are well within walking distance. CONS: The hotel could use a complete “face-lift” as some of the hotel facilities and guest areas are starting to show their age and the structure needs some contemporary style updates to bring it up to par with other newer hotels in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Aging. But great location still.”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been in need of upgrade for the longest time. I was given a room that had been renovated, it was just OK. A bit too common, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good by slightly rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Chestnutmash
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks here on business, and I have to agree with other reviewers that the location can't be beat. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the large shopping complexes and the MRT. It's also easy walking distance to the fantastic botanical gardens. The rooms are good, and the service is very good. The common area is very nice, but my room did have some rough edges - nothing major, but considering the cost per night, I would have expected better. The curtains were poorly fitted, and looked torn due to difficult operation. The bath tub fixture looked slightly beat up and the tub drain never did work properly. The only major gripe I have is the excessive charge for internet service. It's $25/day at the time of this review. Overall, a nice hotel, but I wouldn't consider it a good value - even for a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome end to a spectacular cruise from Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: TheWSTim
Reviews.Content: From the time my partner, Doug, and I arrived until the time we moved up the road for an adventure at a small boutique hotel in China Town, we were treated like kings. From the front door to the closet door, someone was available and responsive to every request. The central location allowed for easy travel by foot, cab, city bus or Duck mobile. This particular Hilton may be one of the best in the world because of the great people that make up the city.

Reviews.Title: “Low to medium low quality for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: roadie123
Reviews.Content: What a big disappointment! I had to request for a room change due to stuffy odor and street noice. The service staff (esp. front desk delivery men) was extremely slow and poor in attitude with the new room key delivery. The desk's outlets were broken and engineering did not know about it. The phone switchboard also relayed the wrong information to enginnering, resulting in multiple back and forth, wasting a lot of my valuable time. For the price that Hilton asks for, the traveler is paying for the location, but NOT for the quality of the room or the level of care. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Incredible Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Limulus
Reviews.Content: It is hard to beat the location of the Singapore Hilton Hotel, on the quieter side of Orchard Road a block away from the frenetic Orchard and Scott intersection. For an older hotel, the public areas look modern and new. The rooms while nice, a little less up-to-date, although we had no complaints. The rooms were very clean, well lit and spacious. The beds were "don't-want-to-get-up" comfortable. But you do want to get up because of the incredible breakfast buffet awaiting you in their main dining room. Go for the breakfast included rate, it's worth it. This buffet has western, Indonesian, Japanese. Chinese dim sum (varieties changed daily) Indian and fresh fruits available. The best part were their croissants that were Paris-perfect! There is a nice rooftop pool with excellent views of the city, and for those inclined, a superlative exercise center.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JLWUK
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before 16 years ago and loved it then. It is in a most fantastic position on orchard road and very close to all the shops and most importantly the metro... which is easy to get around on. It is also the right end if you want to visit the zoo (which cost 15-20SGD about £7-£10 each way in taxi) We had the executive rooms which were lovely and the use of the executive lounge for check in and out and also for breakfast and evening drinks. It was a perfect to start the day with a good breakfast then end it relaxing with drinks and canapes in the lounge. The staff were fantastic especially in the executive lounge .. Pedro was a star and worked so hard and really looked after us.. Thank you Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless personal service, Fantastic Location, Comfortable Rooms, Great Breakfast..”
Reviews.Author: travelliingaussie
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending the weekend just gone at the fabulous Singapore Hilton. We arrived at 7am Saturday morning and were allowed to check into our room straight away which was terrific and very unexpected. Being a Hhonours member I was also offered a 4pm checkout on Monday which was terrific as our flight was departing at 6pm. The breakfast both in the executive lounge and the restaurant were fantastic, lots of choice and everything was on exceptional quality. The evening drinks service in the lounge was also a highlight, with a wide range of canapes and alcohol and also friendly personal service. Two hostesses, Beatrice and Kay, really made our stay special and were so friendly and welcoming. The pool area is a little small and paying $26 for a club sandwich is a little too much but this is standard in hotels, I was certainly not expecting Singapore to be an exception. Overall this was an excellent experience and I look forward to staying at the Singapore Hilton next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but I will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: OK, it is the Hilton. The rooms are nicely designed and the breakfast buffet is well stocked. The location on Orchard means you can walk to some truly great malls and the subway station is only minutes away. Two things will make me stay somewhere else the next time I am in Singapore: 1. The porters were very pushy, almost aggressive. They questioned our ability to carry our own bags and literally tried to grab them while we were carrying them. As this was our first impression of the hotel it was a bad start. 2. After the first night I noticed I my feed had been bitten by some insect. Since we stayed at a far less luxurious hotel in Indonesia the night before I was at first not sure I got these bites during the night at the Hilton. When I woke up after the second night I had even more bites which led me to the conclusion some angry critter lived in/under the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Fresh and Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: s_pearceHoChiMinh
Reviews.Content: Everything from arrival to departure was excellent. When we arrived we were taken quickly to the executive lounge for check-in and were soon in our room. I loved the room, it felt bright, clean and contemporary. It was well maintained and had all the facilities of a good standard hotel. I asked for a quite room, so was given a room at the back of the hotel. It was definitely quiet and the beds were extremely comfortable. The executive lounge in the evening was very good, although busy with a nice atmosphere. The snacks, canapes and drink offered were very good. For breakfast we ate in the main hotel restaurant instead of the executive lounge, the buffet selection was excellent, food from every corner of the world. The staff at breakfast were very efficient and the atmosphere was relaxed. The room service menu was extensive and the quality of food excellent. The location of the hotel is very good, right on Orchard Road and near to all the major shops. The new ION Shopping centre close by, has a good selection of shops and a great food court in the basement. Overall, I am looking forward to staying here again, my only small suggestion is to have free WIFI for guests in the hotel. A great hotel, in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Love It”
Reviews.Author: ThomasT4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the start of Orchard Road across from Orchard towers (you will know when you get there) and has the best room service I have had in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LizaStahl
Reviews.Content: expensive but was great! two tumbs up.. un friendly staff but the food was lovely...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, only comment is they have to keep better track of HH#”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely no problem with this hotel...pool is good, restaurant and bar are great, location is amazing, rooms are new, spacious and comfortable! Staff is very helpful....some of the staff just need to LISTEN a little bit better. I say this, bc they kept asking for my HH#s...so once provided they would not deliver newspaper, or not register my key to access executive floor. It happened a few times, so only thing needed is to make sure they follow up. The gym is probably one of the best I've seen in hotels in Singapore....better than Conrad and Swissotel. Other than that the hotel is great, the comps are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AdelaidianTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Singapore Hilton this month. The hotel is centrally located in Orchard Road- the main tourist shopping district- adjacent to the major shopping areas such as the new Ion Centre. I stayed on one of the Executive Floors- this is well worthwhile, as it entitles you to access to the excellent Executive Lounge. The warmth and friendliness of the staff is excellent. The hotel appears to have been refurbished recently (a member of the staff proudly told me that the hotel is 39 years old- he had been with the hotel since it opened). The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are well appointed. The shower in the marble bathroom has a novel thermostatic control, which lets you set the temperature of the water! In summary, I recommend the Hilton as an excellent hotel with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel along Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Mino_Ona
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel along Orchard very convenient. My teenage daughter and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. If you want to do some shopping then this is a perfect hotel for you. Service is great, room is immaculate, room cleaned everyday, wifi in the room, buffet breakfast varies everyday. Hilton is just a few minutes away from shopping malls i.e. Ion, Takashimaya, Tang's, Isetan and restaurants. Beside the hotel on its right is Forum where you can find Mcdonald's, CPK, Spineli, Starbuck's and high end boutiques. Across Hilton is the Thai Embassy and several high end stores too. City bus stations are just across. Some coffee shops i.e. TCC and McCafe are open 24 hours. MRT is just walking distance too.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: matm48
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with the amenities you expect from Hilton. That said, there are better locations for sightseeing. It was very hard to find restaurants other than Americanized brands (McDonalds, Dairy Queen, Starbucks, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on the executive level”
Reviews.Author: fishle
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hilton here for the first time. I booked over Zuji.com and got a very good deal for the executive level (190 AUD per night). The staff in this hotel is outstanding - so friendly and helpful. Location is great for shopping and the MRT is very close, 5 Min through the Paterson underpass, which was a bit of a problem to find for the first time as there is no traffic light upstairs anymore. The only critic I have with the room is the bathroom. It does look a bit tired and the shower in the bathtub is really not a safe and easy thing to have nowadays. On the other hand I loved the large bathsheets to wrap around. I will definitely be back again at the executive level.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience....”
Reviews.Author: rmg88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in late July and found the hotel to be of very high quality. Room was nice and spacious (felt the bathroom was a little bit cramped). Had a lovely comfy, big bed and quite a large TV. Also the room was very clean and had a very fresh look and feel to it. The staff were really good, found their service and manner to be excellent and very polite and helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel, which was great, and it really catered for Europeans and Americans, which suited us. The hotel is at one end of Orchard road, so couldn't really ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Shop-IT”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in the Hilton Singapore Orchard Road. We like this hotel due to the good service and good location. Location: Right at Orchard Road, you step out of the hotel and you can start shopping. About 30 minutes from Changi Airport and about a 10 minute walk to Orchard Rd Metro station. Rooms: Small, but very clean and nice. Only it seems the bathroom has not been renovated, looks old. Furthermore, the only let down is the bathroom being way too small. Aslo some inconsistency with room service, sometimes complementary water, sometimes not. Breakfast: Previously we never took breakfast (@40SGP++ a person). This time it was included in our rate (we paid 100E a night incl BF). The breakfast is super, one of the best we had in Asia (Hyatt Taipei, Marriott Miri, Crown Plaza Manila rock however!). It is busy and small, but the food is just GREAT!!!! Staff: All very, extremely friendly. Pool: Rooftop, nice but when we were there, there was some renovation going on. Fitness: good. This is a very nice hotel, that makes you feel happy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely !”
Reviews.Author: Takkuto
Reviews.Content: Two months ago, I had my trip at Singapore with my friends. First time we decided to stay at Ibis Bencoolen because It had opened since last month in 2008. However, we changed our hotel to Hilton, Singapore because this hotel provided special rate "Stay 2 nights free 1 nights" especially included buffet breakfast for 2. I think, this price was not expensive at this time and if you have register the member of this hotel, you will also get bonus point from Hilton. Then, this hotel made me impressive with lovely and nice staff. Our room as Deluxe room with King Bed was very softly and made us slept well every night, also LCD 32" inch in room with many favourites TV programs. On the top floor, the sport club is very clean and lot of hi-technology exercise equipments and I loved the swimming pool although it is so small but its design very cute. I recommended everyone to get a breakfast at this hotel which provided many nationalities menu (also Thailand) and everything is very delicious and made me loss my weight 5555. If I will have a chance to travel in Singapore, I will stay at Hilton Singapore again (or may be Conrad Singapore).

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: fabulousguru
Reviews.Content: @ orchard road, walking distance to all shopping mall, lobby floor has all designer brands. Hotel not so expensive as its small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “finally they are getting there..”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: have stayed at the hilton in singapore a few times, however, this was the best stay ever i had. finally they are gettin there with more people to serve you, updated rooms and the attentiveness they lacked in the past. I can only recommend this hotel now. it has great staff and location

Reviews.Title: “Not sure that we would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my partners actual 30th Birthday night and therefore when I made the booking I was advised that we would get a city view room and that there would be a birthday cake waiting in the room for him when we arrived. Arrived in the early afternoon and the check in service was efficient but not great and we did not get the city view room we were expecting. Went to the room and was nicely surprised at house nice it was. The furnishings were lovely, the bathroom had everything you could imagine, there was a business space, lazy chair for reading and a fully stocked mini bar! However, there was no cake, as promised so I went and asked reception and they said they would send one up immediately. Waited for an hour and still no cake and as we were going out to dinner and then to an event I went and asked again and was advised it would be up shortly. We went for a walk for an hour or two and arrived back at the room and still no cake. Called reception again and this time complained about the service and within 15 minutes we had a delicious full size cookies and cream cheese cake garnished with fresh fruit and cream just for two of us.... rich but delicious and worth the wait! Had the free cocktails and nibbles in the executive lounge which were lovely before we ventured out for dinner and a show. Arrived back very late and the turn down service was another nice surprise. Lights dimmed, fresh towels, water bottles and slippers next to the bed and curtains drawn. Breakfast in the morning was world class! Best ever and had everything imaginable! We were on the executive floor so we could have got free breakfast in the executive lounge but chose to go downstairs to the main area... definitely worth it! Location was great being on Orchard Road and close to all shopping malls and services. Many taxi's are outside throughout the day and night so that was great also. Fitness Centre was also fabulous. Everything you need if you want to do exercise on your holiday! Disappointing though was that the pool closed early for a wedding that night. Pool was not the best we have seen but would have been nice to have a swim to cool off. Also, be mindful that internet service in the executive lounge are not available between 4pm and 8pm. Overall stay was comfortable but for the price not sure that we would stay again?

Reviews.Title: “too many private events”
Reviews.Author: leisure99
Reviews.Content: +Convinient location for food and other activities. -My room was on the north side. Even as high as 20+ floor, the noise in the late evening still penetrate the window to my bed. +Breakfast was great. -Internet usage was a modern rip-off at $25 + tax a day. +Very friendly staff. -The hotel blocked the swimming pool access from guests 3-4 days in a single week for "private" events.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: farfaraway99
Reviews.Content: Centrally located with nice, modern rooms. Nothing special though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: VM2
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay here on the way to Europe as we have been to Singapore several times.This hotel has a great position being on Orchard Rd.The staff were very efficient which we appreciated having just arrived on a 11hour flight from NZ.We were upgraded to an executive room which meant we could have breakfast in the executive lounge the next morning,which we enjoyed. If we ever come back to Singapore will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: JulesB66
Reviews.Content: Two nights in a refurbished deluxe room, price-wise reasonable because of the 2-for-1 deal that Hilton currently has for its Asia-Pac hotels. Partner's a Hilton Honours card member hence we decided to stay again (first time was about 5 years ago and the room then needed refurbishment). Check-in was efficient, pleasant. Decent breakfast. Room itself was good, only gripe's that the bathroom's too small (2 people really have to snuggle up to fit in!). Would stay again except maybe next time will book an Executive room.

Reviews.Title: “Have been to better Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: Travller3197
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of days on the way back from London. The hotel is in a good location close to all of the big shopping outlets. The rooms were well appointed but starting to look a bit worn. The carpet could use a good clean. I was very disappointed that the swimming pool closed early to hotel guests on both afternoons for "private functions". In summary, if this were a three star hotel, I would say it was value for money. As a four star, it do doesn't make the grade. I don't think I'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous! Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: janazel
Reviews.Content: I was invited by my friend to stay 2D1N Hilton SG, yes i am local, singaporean. i would rate it as International 5star hotel. Starting from the reception check in service, polite, friendly, efficient. Gd Security to access hotel executive room via lift. The Executive rooms are great, king bed, nice view, shower room comes with all the necessities. there's iron & iron board too(just when i need it), big tv screen with wide variety of channels. Remember one thing bad is that when you switch off the tv with de fav. channel, you've to adjust all over again when you on it. Next, the great lunch, hi-tea & breakfast. Yes, executive have the access to the cocktail in the evening. Nothing comes better with great international cuisine provided by Hilton Hotel. Its definately worth staying for both business/leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “"Do they still come like that!"”
Reviews.Author: Manifestation
Reviews.Content: When wife and myself were checked in courteously and efficiently and ushered to our room we knew that we had not made a wrong choice. It was an Executive Room on a beautifully decorated floor with an executive lounge serving refreshments all day and cocktails in the evenings. With its plush interior, luxurious sofas, a wonderful outside view from the windows and ever helpful attendents even a short sojourn to the executive lounge was enough to refresh and gladden you. The room was spacious with all ameneties that one would expect and then some. The bed was comfortable and the linen inviting. The buffet breakfast that came with the package was the most sumptuous that one could imaging. There was a variety of cuisine, American and continental, with great choices. The breakfast was available in the main dining room as well as a special room for executive floors. It was the highlight of the stay. Other facilities like swimming pool and gymnasius did not let the hotel down. SGD330 tag for all the comfort made the stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, what else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: SchackStockholm
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at this hotel but received excellent value for money, especially as we had booked a room at half price, but still got a room on one of their "Executive floors", giving us access to a VIP area. That meansf ree cocktails between 6 and 8 pm, and the choice between different breakfast buffets. Being normal tourists we were of course pleased as punch. Very friendly and professional staff, butthis being Singapore, you would not expect less!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel good rooms location restaurant facilities”
Reviews.Author: Duck-Feet-67
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in April 2009 for three nights. It was a fantastic location, spacious room, massive bed, the breakfast buffet was brillaint. The bathroom was spacious and the shower gel, shampoo etc topped up daily. The mini bar like most hotels was over the top but super markets close by to buy wine beer etc. The tea and coffee were topped up daily. If you prefer English tea bags take some with you as it was green tea bags. The room was cleaned daily and the beds changed once during just a three night stay. The hotel itself has a lovely roof top pool with a fantastic view, the restaurant was good, drink was expensive. We would use this hotel again. It was booked with Hilton direct on a special weekend rate and cost us £290.59 ($363 SGD) for the three nights in a King Hilton delux room including breakfast. Its located on the Orchard Road in middle of the shopping area which is very busy and a two minute walk to the underground which was very easy to get around on. Our room was quiet at night but fairly high up. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: M-G-Wales
Reviews.Content: The Hlton in Singapore is efficiently run and has some nice vews. The staff is smiley and pleasant. Convenient location . I would return it.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable High Standards”
Reviews.Author: Mistie20
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the executive floor for 2 nights at the end of a trip to the region. The staff training and standards at Hiltons around the world are reliably good and this was no exception. We would particularly mention Delien, a member of the exec. lounge staff, for her attention to detail and lovely manner. We disliked the approach to the pool area - either by lift to a conference floor or by 'back stairs' - signage could be improved. We were unsure if the stairs led to the pool - room for a lovely mural.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: anirban72
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel at end of Orchard Road. Well maintained and clean. Excellent breakfast buffet and very god service make the place more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kangarooboy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 2 nights at the Singapore Hilton. We were on the 10th.floor & found our room & bathroom o be modern & clean. It was a quiet room despite fronting Orchard Rd. Air-Conditioning was adjustable which we appreciated. The location was very close to several Dept.Stores & many shopping centres within walking distance. The gymnasium was well equipped the pool,though small,was just what we wanted. Staff at reception and bell-boys were excellent. Only minor complaint was the little cake-shop in the lobby doesn't serve coffee;you have to go into the bistro but when we saw a sandwich cost $29 we went to Starbucks. ( 4 minutes walk)

Reviews.Title: “A real nice hotel in the heart of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Nomaad
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly suprised how nice this Hilton is. Reviews state that this is an old hotel but they certainly have top notch amenities and the service was awesome. The executive lounge was outstanding and the rooms were very comfortable and modern. I would definetly come back here on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Old lady still going strong”
Reviews.Author: karin stockholm
Reviews.Content: Hilton Singapore Its old, its not as spectacular as many other hotels in Singapore but I experienced an excellent stay within the price range for a 4+ star hotel. It paid off to be a loyal customer cause my room was ready already at 6 am when I arrived after a long haul flight. The service from arrival to departure was promt, efficient and always with a smile from the attentive staff. I stayed on executive floor in a newly refurbished room which was spacious, quiet. However I agree with previous comments that the bathrooms are on the small side. The executive lounge was very pleasant and you had always two breakfast options if you wanted to have a continental one in the lounge or a more filling one in main restaurant. In the afternoon one of the hotels signatures cakes were available and throughout the day you could get softdrinks and hotdrinks. The pre dinner cocktail attracted a good crowd and the appetizers that were served where a delight with a touch of Asia as well as more western sandwiches. What I also appreciated was that you had access to free laptops in the lounge so you could sit wherever you wanted and not was stucked in a more office like space. It was a while since I stayed at Hilton and I enjoyed the refurbished pool area with sun and shade most of the day. The “glow bar” with whole food sandwiches and smoothies where in a weird location- just by an overpass to hotel Four seasons and I wonder how many that really find their way there? The smoothies were good though but I doubt the placet will be around for so long! Not many people there during my stay! The location is fab with the Singapore shopping just outside the hotel and a short jogging away is the Botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room in need to update”
Reviews.Author: Karl80
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Singapore Hilton towards the end of April 09. The hotel itself is in an excellent location, Orchard Road - amongst shopping malls, in fact it has its own exclusive shopping arcade next to reception. The reception is standard Hilton, but a pleasant addition is a piano player each evening near the bar and restaurant. Our standard room was ok but some of the decor could do with updating, including the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. There wasn't a great choice at breakfast, and water was dripping from the ceiling onto our table, apparently from an air conditioning unit! We had dinner at the hotel, and the food was tasty with a reasonable choice on the menu. We were told when we booked that there was a 25% reduction on food for Hilton honours guests. When we checked out we noticed the reduction wasn't included in our bill so had to remind reception staff. There is an outside pool on the top floor. Again, this could do with updating. Although there is a poolside bar, it wasn't open when we used the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business + upmarket tourists”
Reviews.Author: pavit77
Reviews.Content: Nice business hotel situated at the beginning of orchard road and a 3 to 4 min liesurely walk from the orchard road MRT. Not very big rooms. Functional with standard facilities. Food is wonderful and the breakfast fare is to-die-for. You dont really need to eat the remaining meals since you'r out and about the city and singapore spoils you for choice. Else for a couple on holiday in singapore, it presents a safe and upmarket envirnment. Staff is friendly but clinical. -ve.....a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Truly homely”
Reviews.Author: Raju4656
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Hilton, Orchard Road, Singapore, though I had been to Singapore twice earlier. And what a wonderful experience it was! Apart from an excellent location - at the up-market end of the scintillating Orchard Road - Hilton offers a truly comfortable stay, homely atmosphere and world class service and food. I was attending an official training programme which required considerable attention to putting in time for preparing for the next day's sessions. The hotel was a perfect place to work undisturbed and met all my professional requirements like internet facility, fax service etc. And in the evenings one could relax and have an enjoyable meal to de-stress oneself. I will definitely love to stay here again whenever I visit Singapore, especially with my wife. Its location makes it perhaps one of the most convenient places to stay, without the trouble of longcab rides to reach the hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arian99
Reviews.Content: Quicke check in with quick room service and a nice spread of breakfast and dinner are something one would relish here. The hotel located centrally gives a good opportunity to explore city without wasting much time in travel. The acomodation was reasonable nad the room service was good. Its good hotel for business visit and has nice arrangement for all your busines needs. The food was really nice and had a good choice .

Reviews.Title: “Great facility with excellent location with a very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: expatrick
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore and I'm pleased that we selected the Hilton. It's a beautiful facility within walking distance of a light rail facility, great shopping and the Hard Rock Cafe. Our room included a buffet breakfast in the dinning room, which was excellent - probably the best I've ever seen. It's a self-serve buffet but the staff is quite attentive and well worth the value. I found the room to be fairly small for a family of four, but it is probably normal for the region. I was also surprised by the ladies of the evening lined up along the street out front, but again it's probably the norm for the area and not unique to the property. The roof-top pool was a great place for the kids and the concierge desk was very helpful with arranging transportation and suggesting day trips. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Psalm2
Reviews.Content: Take in the view of the bustling Orchard Road from the comfort of the rooms of Hilton. It is just 20 minutes from the Changi Airport and is Ideally located from business and shopping point of view. When not doing anything one can work out at the gymn on the highest floor of the hotel or jump in the luxurious pool. The Sunday champagne brunch is excellent at Checkers Brasserie and so are the oysters at the Harbor Grill and Oyster Bar. All rooms have working and dining area. One can watch a movie or surf the web with wireless internet connection. Enjoy shopping in the malls on the Orchard Road and stay at Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “very good rooms, excellent location, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: view033
Reviews.Content: Got an upgrade as a hilton honours member. very good rooms, ability to access the executive lounge with internet facility and ability to entertain guests too. all in all a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JJimBean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a two night break in March 2009. Chose the hotel on Expedia due to its competitive rate and central location. Travelling light so arrived from the airport by MRT which took 45 minutes. The trip involved two changes of train but as these simply entailed crossing from one platform to another that was no hassle. The nearest MRT station to the hotel is Orchard which is 4 to 5 minutes walk. The hotel reception was very busy on check in but I was soon dealt with. I made my own way to the room and found that it had already been occupied. The receptionist had realised his mistake and caught up with me. Back in reception the front desk manager was very apologetic and after about 20 minutes another room was found for me and I was upgraded to an executive floor. The room appeared much the same as the first room however I had access to the executive lounge. I made my way to the lounge only to find that it was at full capacity (7.30pm on a Friday night) so I returned to my room and the lounge attendant called me 10 minutes later to let me know a table was available. Complimentary drinks (a limited range of spirits, house wines and beers) and a cold buffet provided a good start to the evening. Next morning I had breakfast in the executive lounge at the suggestion of the lounge attendant as the hotel restaurant on the ground floor was very busy. Breakfast comprises a fresh fruits, juices, cold meats, cheeses, various types of eggs, various breads/toast etc which was ample choice and the atmosphere was relaxed. The second morning I had breakfast in the main restaurant on the ground floor which offered greater choice but was extremely busy and noisy. I would recommend the executive lounge if the hotel is busy. I tried out the hotel gym which is well equipped and has helpful staff. I didn't manage to use the rooftop pool but it looked very pleasant. The best feature of the hotel is certainly its location for anyone wanting to be close to the shops and sights. It is not the most modern hotel in the area but perhaps the rates offered reflect this. All in all a good choice and somewhere I would consider staying at when I am next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the quiter end of Orchard Road and the 2 minute extra walk is well worth it. No complaints as such, although generally, the reception in "business like" with little warmth. The concierge folk are great and remember me, and my preferences despite my visits every 6 months or so.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: traveltragic01
Reviews.Content: It’s 8am on a Sunday morning. I’m exhausted after a long flight and would kill for a shower and a quick lie down before a late morning meeting. I arrive at the Hilton knowing that check in isn’t until 2pm and expect the worse i.e. there won’t be a room available. A polite and friendly gentleman at checkin greets me – he acknowledges my request for a quiet room on a high floor. He explains that the only room they have available is on the Orchard Road side – so it is a little noisier but he’s happy for me to change later in the afternoon. 5 minutes later I was in my room! This type of great customer service has been the exception vs the norm of late and pleasingly during my 4 nights stay at the Hilton high standards were consistently maintained. More about this hotel………….it’s well located on Orchard Rd; close to the many shops and restaurants. The room was spotless and always cleaned before midday. It had everything I expect from a good hotel – up to date audiovisual; broadband internet; comfortable but firm bed; fabulous shower with a temperature setting feature that I would love to have at home and nice toiletries. Food was expensive but good quality. Head to China Town for ‘cheap eats’. The gym was excellent – x4 treadmills; x4 bikes; weights etc all in working order. The pool was on the roof; clean with nice lounges and a bar. The Orchard Road side was a little noisy but not overly so. I did end up moving to a room on the other side but I’m a light sleeper and it probably wouldn’t bother most people. The Hilton to their credit affected this move efficiently within 5 minutes of my request.
