Shopping tips – Hilton is part of a mall with high end designer shops; next door is the Forum which is great for kids toys and clothes; down the road is Wisma Atria – my favourite for some interesting mid level boutiques. Next to Wisma is Ngee Ann City that had a department store (can’t remember the name) with some good clothes and accessories plus 2 basement levels of cheaper shops with the designer outlets on the upper levels. I will stay at the Hilton if I visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kewdale
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights, the room was clean & well appointed. when we arrived there was no lights on the floor, (a fuse must of tripped out). but after a phone call to the check in desk the lights were back on within 5 minutes, this was the only hiccup we had with this hotel, the staff were very friendly & helpfull, there was a large selection of hot & cold food for breakfast, the hotel is only a couple of minutes walk to the MRT station on orchard road, the singapore sightseeing bus stopped just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: prehim
Reviews.Content: Fab location- close by to all the shops and literally a 5 min walk to the MRT. there was an Efficient check in and check out and staff were very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was included in my rate - great range of options and good food. the only downside, is the swimming pool and the rooftop view.

Reviews.Title: “Interconnecting rooms, very friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Busygoing
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore following a long haul flight and aren't we glad we stayed at the Hilton. This is one of the few hotels that will guarantee us interconnecting rooms so our young kids can be next door to us before we depart UK. The check in was most straight forward and done in the exec lounge. We have the most wonderful breakfast at Hilton (we also stayed at the Intercontinental and St Regis previously). The location could not have been better located as it is right on Orchard Road. Very good value as the 2nd room for the kids was half price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLad
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here to be within easy reach of Orchard Road so we could invest in the local economy. We were dog tired after our far east adventure and desperately needed some shopping therapy and R&R. Our welcome on check-in was like dealing with a robot. A friendly smile and a hint of personality would have gone a long way. She answered my innocent questions about breakfast and Hilton HHonors coldly before we were verbally prodded on our way - we eventually stumbled upon the lifts. Bad first impression and one you don't forget easily. The room was a generous size although the bathroom was small. The beds were comfortable. Unfortunately there was no turn down service. The pictures of the gym and pool looked very good but we didn't use them. I've stayed in much better hotels in Singapore - being on Orchard Road no longer is important to me... I'll stay at a better hotel next time and just jump in a cab to Orchard Road. The shopping was just brilliant though.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: kuyajepwi
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Hilton was one of our break-from-bustle-of-the-city things. We stayed for one night, and the room facilities were okay. My observations: - 1. Each room is equipped with a DVD player. You can also rent DVDs from the executive lounge. Not all hotels have this :) 2. No complimentary bottled water. Most of the 3-5 star hotels I've been to usually provide this. 3. Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries - Hilton provides posh toiletries, save for a bubble foam. Haha. 4. Excellent room interior and housekeeping services. 5. Buffet - I really didn't like the breakfast buffet - very few choices. But since we got the room at a very low rate, I think the facilities and amenities we have used are not so bad! Hilton also boasts a centralized location - just a few minutes away from the Orchard shopping district :)

Reviews.Title: “Awfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: attie1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a executive room for 2 nights. when checked in was a que of about 5 people, asked a staff member that was passing if we can go to executive lounge to check in, was told wait till my turn then they will help you. when my turn at front desk they asked me if i want to check in in the lounge, bit late. room meant to be refurbished. very cheaply done, bathroom and mini bar, closet needs refurbished. did not even have face cloths in bathroom. loads of black hair in bath and towels. executive lounge to small. we had to wait to get a seat on both nights. eventually got some seats but had to share a 4 persons table with others. only positve there was the staff being very friendly, probarly embarrassed more like it. had breakfast in the main breakfast restaurant not exec lounge. again to small and had to wait for a table. wanted to sun bath aroud the pool during the day. only about 7 sunbeds and 7 seperate chairs around the pool. for such a big a hotel they need more. ask the staff if anymore, they advised me no. had to wait for about 1 hour for a bed.had to lie on the floor in the mean time. pool area def needs a good refurbishment. i think there are to many rooms for there facilities. i did fill a comments card in and gave to front desk on check out. still no reply from the manager. i will def not recommend this hotel to anybody. do not stay here !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “consistent quality for the last 20 years”
Reviews.Author: hetsen
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting this hotel since 1986. I have been disappointed. Excellent hotel, great location at Orchard Road( shopping, restaurants) .

Reviews.Title: “Still living up to its name”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Executive dlx room with access to exec lounge. It's very good value for money. The hassle-free check-in was done at the exec lounge on 22nd floor. Room given was on the same floor - which made it so easy to access the lounge anytime. The refurbished room has a futuristic look to it, like the reading lights on each side of the bed, the huge plasma tv with dvd player, the nice recessed lightings and the glass-top workdesk. The tv programs are better than most hotels I stayed in - these include 2 thai channels (ch5 and 7), german, australian, japanese, french, etc etc apart from the staples like cnn, bbc and Ch news asia. Breakfast is by far one of the best I've had! I chose to eat at the ground floor cafe, rather than restricting myself to the continental breakfast at the exec lounge. The spread at the groundfloor cafe was excellent, and so was the quality - like SCS butter, Hero jams, wide range of breads and bagel, carved honey baked ham, good-tasting asian tim-sums like char siew pow, chee cheong fun, to japanese food. Service was superlative, everywhere I go, from the staff (even the electricians and plumbers) in the elevators who greeted me and had genuine smiles all around, to the doormen and the exec lounge staff who were so helpful. The disappointments I have can be categorised into 4 areas: (1) the smallish bathroom with a a tiny bathtub cum shower. I would prefer shower and bath to be separated. Having said that, the hotel uses top-line fittings like Grohe faucets and quality products like Crabtree & Evelyn's La Source. (2) the other area which fell short of my expectation was the rather dated swimming pool on the 24th floor, which has to be accessed by climbing the staircase from the gym at the 23rd floor. I was transformed to the 1970s era! (3) no complimentary use of broadband internet. I was told the hotel charges 40 cents per minute if I access internet from my room, or S$28 for whole day usage. I kept my Sony Viao at home! (4) the closet in my room (room 2225) was the only feature I suspect which had been left when the room was renovated, because the doors to the closet were rickety and could not close properly. Similarly there are signs in the public areas like the ground floor toilet (next to the bar) where the cubicles look so old. Even worse was the unrenovated toilet at the 2nd level shopping gallery. It looks so out of place from what a 5-star hotel could provide. For a moment I thought I was in the toilet of some shopping mall in chinatown! I mean, it's miles apart after passing through the classy boutiques of D&G, Armani, etc.

Reviews.Title: “would like to go again”
Reviews.Author: TPE
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel to stay during the X'mas time. The orchard road was fulfill lots of people & the X'mas Lighting. So beautiful on the street. Hotel is extremely comfortable to stay as home. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, helpful/friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: JohnEO
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Singapore Hilton with a little trepidation after having read some of the slightly critical reviews below and having stayed at the really excellent Shangri-La on a previous visit. And so is this hotel. We really cannot agree with some of the comments below. The staff is welcoming and helpful and – we do not know whether or not it was being given a room on the executive floor – our room was excellent and, I suspect, recently refurbished. The bathroom was smaller than some I’ve seen but not unbearable so. It was also pristine clean. We were also able to check in late morning without a problem. The hotel’s location on Orchard Road is a plus. Even though the road itself is quite noisy and very busy, you would not know this from your room. Getting about Singapore is a breeze. The MRT public transport system is cheap, efficient, extensive and clean; and if you prefer to take taxis, they are too; But watch out for an additional charge if the hotel calls a taxi for you. We did not try the restaurants. However, the breakfast and pre-dinner titbits and wine are excellent. The staff is excellent and the food is good. In contrast to Hilton executive lounges in the US, wine is complimentary and served by the friendly and excellent staff. They could hardly be more solicitous! Breakfast in the executive lounge is also excellent. Knowing the excellent Changi Palace at the Shangri-La, we did not give the Singapore Hilton a chance for dinner. The only really problems we encountered were to do with internet availability. Our room was on the executive level, but offered no compliementary wireless access. This was only available in the executive lounge, and then only until 8pm. When I questioned the executive lounge manager about both these nonsensical policies I was offered no explanation. I have also questioned the nonsensical absence of wireless in executive rooms in Hiltons in the US, and also received no sensible answer. However, as I say, this was the only real problem at the Singapore Hilton. We visited Little India and had a nice lunch there. Next day, we went on a duck tour of the harbour, which is underwhelming and missable. Not missable, however, is the Changi Museum, which provides a poignant and trenchant reminder of the brutality of the Japanese occupation and the debt Singapore owns to the liberating British forces. Would we return to this hotel. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Hilton I've Stayed at in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: kirrabob
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, the pool and spa areas are great too. Executive floor is good value if you want to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a great hotel in a super Location, The room was a great size for a hotel in Singapore. The service was great. The buffet breakfast was huge! They had a Japanese dinner buffet on the night I checked in and it was Sashimi heaven! Oh and BTW there were 2 Lamborghini's and a Ferrari parked in the porch. Made my day!

Reviews.Title: “NIce location”
Reviews.Author: 3T
Reviews.Content: Hilton has a great location at the Orchard road. It is convenient point for shopping. The hotel is nice and its room is clean, spcacious and comfortable. The flat screen TV is good for sports and is a plus. There is a nice desk for working which is good for business people. The buffet breakfast has a variety of choice and is good. The overall experience is positive.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Hilton hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Heavan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days and expericenced a stay expected from a 4 star hotel. The hotel's location on Orchard Road was perfect for the shops and the the metro. The hotel is very functional with one of the benefits being a great buffet breakfast. We stayed in an excutive suite which gave access to pre-dinner drinks and breakfast. The rooms even in the executive suite are what you would expect of a standard room with good business facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Okay rooms, Disappointing public areas”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is located in an older building, I would guess from the 1960s or 1970s. I would think which has been upgraded, but it lacks the size and grandeur you have come to expect in Asian hotels, and suffers because of this The rooms are good, definitely above average, not huge, but it's all there. The public areas though are rubbish for a hotel of this calibre and price and alleged star rating. Against this it is on Orchard Road and that in itself gets over the restaurant and bar problem because you are surrounded by options. However, the hotel is saved by this happy co-incidence when it should have better options for bars and restaurants than it does ,especially given that it is not all that cheap. I would definitely suggest that the Hilton go about acquiring some extra space and get this built in. Otherwise it will just be a stopover hotel and quite pricey for that purpose. Having said that, i stayed twice because it is convenient. So if you like getting out of the hotel to eat like me this is good, but this should be reflected in the price which it isn't. So this means that is average in my opinion. Would i stay again. I dont care

Reviews.Title: “Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: travelboy2000
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Singapore Hilton several times over the past year. The best part of the hotel is the location: If you are in Singapore for business, you can hardly go better for that price - situated right on Orchard Road, you are in walking distance to almost anywhere. The problem with the Hilton was that it was getting a bit old and "used", but I just was there again, and apparently a major overhaul has progressed. I got a room that was so new that it smelled a bit too much of new paint, but now it is up to standard of what you expected from a hotel of this range - light wooden panelling, beige carpet, new glass desk, flat screen TV, new bathroom - all in the deluxe room. The gym has gotten some new equipment and the pool is currently going through renovations (and will remain closed until sometime in September) - so keep that in mind when booking. The service remains up to par and in the new state, I find it a great bet for a stay in Singapore. Due note however, that they are currently tearing up the sidewalk in front of the hotel and you will have a very loud construction site, if your window is towards the street. Work starts at 9am and goes through 5pm - so don't sleep late. According to the hotel, they should be finished by October.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at the Singapore Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Pat71
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore about once a month and always stay at the Hilton. It is a great business hotel, the staff are superb and they always remember your name and give you that little bit extra special service. Whilst it may not be as flash as some of the other hotels in Singapore for practicality and price I do not think you can beat it. Great location for people on a stop over in Singapore. The Club rooms on the front of the building are the best as you get a balcony - if you can use it with the humidity! The Club Floors are well worth the extra not just for the room but for the free breakfast, free evening drinks and use of the lounge. The pool is currently being refurbed but your can use the Four Seasons Pool next door.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but NOT up to par”
Reviews.Author: amlunchlady
Reviews.Content: When we were assigned to go over seas and I found out our training was to be in Singapore I was excited. I was even more excited to find out we were staying at the Hilton on the famous Orchard Road. Not only that, the company arranged for our daughters, 14 & 16, to have their own room, and we weere put on the business floor so we had access to the lounge. WOW! Well things were not quite as swell as I had imagined. First off they let our reservation go. We had a late arrival and our company rep had not asked for a late check in. So no connecting rooms, and we were in a smoking room. Nicely enough the next day the moved us to a different floor with connecting rooms and non-smoking... but it was a bit of a process. The rooms (all 4 that we saw anyway) were musty and in great need of refurbishing. The business lounge was good and the location easy to get to and from. (most taxi drivers know where to go when you say Hilton) Step out the doors of the Hilton and you are right on the busy street with all the shops and food and people galore. I am not a huge fan of big cities or posh shopping, so there was little to hold my attention directly on Orchard Rd... but the zoo is terrific! The Singapore Flyer was neat, but it is a much longer ride than it needs to be... esp. if you get stuck up there with loads of kids. The hotel buffet breakfast was terrific. Lots of fresh fruits, fresh cooked foods and choices of local or western foods. My daughter was thrilled to have her first piece of dragon fruit frechly peeled and sliced just for her on our first morning there. So while I know that I just must have had my hopes too high, I have to say that I was slightly dissapointed with having stayed at this Hilton. I have been at nicer and cleaner small chain hotels, so for Hilton standards thisone comes up a little short.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hopsing
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Hilton unfortunately stuck in the hotel room with two children having come down with the flu and this being aggravated by an allergy to the feather duvets and pillows in the hotel room. Unfortunately our holiday was ruined, but I cannot speak more highly of each and every staff member I had contact with, from the gracious manageress to reception, porters, housekeeping etc. I have not experienced such warmth and kindness in a city hotel before. When I requested a doctor on the phone, on both occasions it literally took a couple of seconds before they had paged the doctor and he was on the phone. As much as my memories of Singapore unfortunately will be of stuck in a hotel room with a fever and bronchitis (with two kids fighting over the tv remote),I will remember the incredible hospitality at this hotel. My kids were a bit disappointed in the pool, but I am sure the renovation they are planning will be great. Thank you to all at the Hilton Singapore. Sandra Burt from Cape Town

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in this very centrally located property. As Hilton iamond members we experienced the same as a previous review and did not get an upgrade (very unusual) however we did have access to the excellent executive lounge. The rooms which have been upgraded were modern and bright. Our room which was at the front was quite noisy from passing traffic(as it is right on Orchard Road) . I guess this is an downside to central location. We had complimentary breakfast in the restaurant and their full buffet was excellent and a wide choice available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the hilton singapore”
Reviews.Author: chrisandilda
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hilton singapore before heading back to oz and loved every aspect of our stay there. It is in a prime location on orchard road and since the primary objective of our stay in singapore was to shop till i dropped the hilton was the perfect place to stay. The rooms were bright and spacious with LCD tv, huge king bed and functional work/sitting area. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but with all the extra towels, amenities and toiletries they provided that soon made you forget about the small bathroom - and hey as long as there is ample hot water - i like my long hot showers especially after a long day of shopping in singapores humid heat - and a clean flushing toilet i guess thats all the counts really. Didnt eat at the hotel as there is plenty of cheaper eats around singapore and minibar/laundry prices are that of a typical 5star property - EXPENSIVE, so stay away from them. Staff were helpful and friendly enough - although the staff at The Regent where we stayed last time we visited singapore were MUCH more friendlier and attentive to our needs. All in all will definitely stay at the hilton when we visit singapore again as location and room quality was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Same high standards”
Reviews.Author: Tam Carr
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Hilton in Singapore and it was equally as good as the first time. Rooms have been upgraded to have the LCD television sets now and there is nothing I can really say to fault the place. Complimentory toiletries even include mouthwash. One thing to note is that the swimming pool is to be closed in the near future for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at Hilton Singapore”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers3
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great on the main shopping drag of Singapore. I was amazed at the top stores located in the lobby area of the hotel. However the hotel is not at the top of its class in comparison. I would rate it a 3-4 star hotel. The hotel needs updating in most parts of its hotel. The cafe which serves breakfast buffet, needs better quality of food. Don't go there 1/2 hour before the buffet ends. They don't refill the food as much. Breads and fruits are very quick to disappear. The swimming pool was VERY disappointing. The pictures are not at all what it seems like. The pool is very deep, and rusted. Don't plan on using this facility. Also there is no jacuzzi or hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be renovated--even the Exec floor”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: This Hilton needs some help. I was on the executive floor. My bathroom was sour smelling and the room had wet and filthy carpet. I stayed there (and would stay again) only for the Hilton points. There are much better properties in Singapore so if you don't care about the points then go some place else. It needs some major renovations starting with the carpet. The continental breakfast in the lounge is ok but no omelets. Most lounges in Asia always have omelets. Also, the nightly refreshments are for only 2 hours so you have to be quick. But the staff is very nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but 1970's rooftop pool is appalling”
Reviews.Author: ilockyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights in March 2008. This was a good hotel in a super location. Staff were very good as was the buffet breakfast. Having 2 children I booked the hotel for the rooftop pool. The pool is like something from the 1970's. It is appalling with broken tiles and terribly dated decor. For children the pool is actually dangerous as the edges are very steep. There are also no pool services (drinks/food etc). If it wasn't for the pool five stars - but the pool needs completely renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Confusion reigns”
Reviews.Author: hnewburn
Reviews.Content: Went with several colleagues on a business trip, couldn't get the corporate rate, but got bumped to the executive floor which was nice. I was offered a S$40 food/beverage voucher (worth about 2 drinks in the lounge) and a selection from 6 gifts worth about $20 each, which was nice. The room was small, but comfortable. Fruit and water were waiting and the bed was firm enough that I got a good nights sleep. One night on returning to my room, I got a message saying to please contact the executive floor. When I did, they told me that there was an error in my booking and that my stay was actually an extra S$125 per night. I was too tired to deal with it and waited until the next day. I went to the executive desk and we argued for several minutes before they finally agreed that if there was an error in my rate it should have been identified when I checked in, as opposed to telling me 3/4 of the way through my stay that it would be an extra S$500 / night. They begrudgingly agreed to the rate. Similar problems happened to my colleagues on check-in as well. I like Hilton, but stuff like this is not good. I'm waiting to see if I get a survey from this stay...

Reviews.Title: “Best location and most comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: Wonderdful location!!! This hotel is right in the middle of busy Orchard street. Eveything; many, many shopping malls and subway are within walking distance. You can shop till you drop, although Singapore shopping can be a lot more expensive than other SE Asia cities. The hotel has done a wonderful job renovating the hotel rooms. The furniture and bathroom arrangement were tops. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have for a long, long time. The TV and working desk are super functional and beautiful. Many, many TV stations. If I need to find something to complain, it would be the Executive lounge breakfast. It was very healthy but was miserable for me. There is no hot food at all. All cold cut, and fruit. The only thing warm were a cup of tea and the toast I made. I would want some hot food in the morning. There is opportunity for improvement for this hotel. Anyway, there are many, many nice restaurants around, even with a 24 hours McDonald is right next door. So you will never go hungry anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and tired - in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: AK_business_traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Singapore on a couple of different occasions. I agree with other reviewers who have commented that the property seems quite dated. It's sorely in need of a renovation. On my first stay, I was upgraded to a suite on the Executive Floor. The suite had been recently remodeled, and was quite nice - no complaints. However, on my return visit, I was given a regular room with a bathroom that absolutely reeked of mildew. It also was pretty grungy looking - dirty floors and so on. I asked to be moved to a second room, only to get a room on the 11th floor. Supposedly, the room (and the entire floor) was non-smoking. However, this was simply not true. The room, along with the pillows and bedlinens, all smelled extremely strongly of cigarette smoke - enough to give one a headache after just a few minutes. This siutation was exacerbated by the fact that none of the windows open - so no way to get any kind of natural ventilation at all. The decor in the regular rooms is also pretty dated, and the rooms feel quite dark. The breakfast offered in Oscar's restaurant is decent. Nothing too special or out of the ordinary, but passable. Staff is of course quite solicitous and accommodating. Overall, I think that there are much better properties in Singapore that are in this price range. I wonder when Hilton plans to get on the ball and renovate this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn out...”
Reviews.Author: sloanbj
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of several days in the hotel after four days. I'm not sure I would recommend it all that highly. I paid $200/night and was upgraded to an executive room. The first room I entered was under construction, so they had to move me. Sloppy work. The second room I stayed with (too much trouble to change again), but the bathroom really smelled of mildew. The hallway on the executive floor kind of smelled old and mildewy. Internet access cost S$35/day which kind of sucks. Had breakfast in the exec lounge one day which was a nice perk I guess. Swimming pool on the top floor is tiny and requires climbing a filthy staircase. This hotel has no place to sit in the lobby! If you meet anyone you have to stand. This may be due to the prostitution problem in the area. I'm not kidding, the entire block across the street is packed with male and female street walkers. Whatever. Good luck. Next time I'll try the Intercon or the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton on the executive floor for two nights whilst on business. Lovely room, newly renovated, spacious with a work desk area, flat screen TV, Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. Enormous bed with fantastic pillows. Food was excellent too including at the conference we attended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: kpth
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a business trip in Singapore. The hotel is nice, it's a Hilton, so you now what to expect. Location wise, it is great, right on Orchard road, close to shopping centers & MRT. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Why the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: badrox
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand some of the reviews here. Was skeptical after reading the "bad this...bad that". As a Diamond member, this place is great. Breakfast is awesome, the staff is amazingly friendly, the rooms are standard exec. rooms. Nice beds, 32 in flat tvs, etc. Not disappointed at all. -Bill

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service but the rooms were average =”
Reviews.Author: MrsDandFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 children 5yr and 9yr) stayed at the hilton for 2 nights during a very quick singapore stopover. Firstly, it must be mentioned that the reception and concierge staff were exceptional from the time we walked in the door to the time we left. We arrived rather weary from 3 hours sleep the night before and were delighted that we could check into our room early (10am) and that the check-in process was extremely quick and efficient. Unfortunately the rooms were less than expected for a hilton hotel. The room was comfortable enough, but in need of a revamp. The pool, located on the roof-toop is similary outdated, and as it would appear, rarely frequented. The pool chairs and tables are very old and the pool bar seems to have closed down. The location wasnt too bad and would lsuit people that were there to shop as there are many large dept stores and shops nearby. However, as mentioned before, the stregth of this hotel was certainly its staff. In fact, we left our camera charger behind in the room and didnt realised until we arrive in Malaysia. The concierge staff efficiently organised for it to be mailed to us.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Not very impressed for a Hilton. Hilton is not cheap. Yet, they can't give you a small bottle of water. You have to boil tap water or drink the overpriced imported mineral water. They have signs asking you to conserve water, not to change sheets or towels so often.... are they really concerned about the environment or they are just concerned about making more profit? Why not give us some rebates if we don't change our sheets / towels if they are really serious about environmental issues. SGD35 daily rate for internet? This is really too much! No doubt that the location is great, but for the same price there are several other hotels that are better just nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mudengineer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in Singapore over the years but this one has to be the best yet, Plus it's probably the oldest as well. I was on the executive floor the accomadation was excellent the staff where very attentive polite and curtious. The location on Orchard Road is very central and accessable. All in all if you are traveling on business to Singapore this is the place to stay for the best value for money

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hilton??!!”
Reviews.Author: Korean_rookie
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this is a Hilton hotel. Rooms are small and looks old. Location wise, not very convenient although it's on Orchard road. When I first saw how run-down the hotel was, I can't believe it's a Hilton. For a cheaper price, I can get a better room in a newer hotel. Time for my company to start looking for a new corporate hotel in Singapore.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 581 Orchard Road, Singapore SG 238883, Singapore
